0.title: Union Minister explains why air ticket prices haven't come down
0.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday asked if people ever wondered why air ticket prices haven't come down. Stating that Aviation Turbine Fuel constitutes about 40% of airline operations cost, Puri tweeted, "West Bengal, Maharashtra & Delhi impose massive 25%+ VAT on ATF while BJP states UP & Nagaland; & UT of J&K charge just 1%," he tweeted.

1.title: Shehnaaz to make her B'wood debut with Salman's 'Kabhi Eid...': Reports
1.article_body: Actress, former 'Bigg Boss' contestant Shehnaaz Gill will reportedly make her Bollywood debut with Salman Khan's 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. According to reports, the actress has joined the cast of the film and will be seen opposite actor Aayush Sharma. Speaking about the project, Aayush had said that he's looking forward to experimenting with his "cinematic aptitude" with this film.

2.title: T'gana Minister inaugurates Thermo Fisher's R&D facility in Hyd
2.article_body: Telangana Minister for IT and Industries KT Rama Rao (KTR) on Thursday inaugurated the Thermo Fisher research and engineering centre's India Engineering Centre (IEC) in Hyderabad. Thermo Fisher's IEC is being set up with an investment of about $15 million (₹1,14,89,70,000) and will employ over 450 diversely talented engineers and vendor partners.

3.title: It's a ridiculous turf war: Prakash on Devgn-Sudeep's national language debate
3.article_body: Actor Prakash Belawadi, who starred in 'The Kashmir Files', spoke about the recent national language debate between Ajay Devgn and Kiccha Sudeep. Prakash said it looks like a "ridiculous turf war". "Hindi isn't a national language because there's no designated national language in India...To convert this into an identity battle of your language versus my language is ridiculous," he added.

4.title: Bowlers are putting Kohli in a spot, letting him make a mistake: Vettori
4.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Virat Kohli who has scored 128 runs in IPL 2022 so far, ex-RCB captain Daniel Vettori said, "The bowler is putting Kohli in a spot and letting him make a mistake." "You...got to be all-out aggressive," added Vettori. Kohli was dismissed for nine off 10 balls against RR, having recorded two consecutive golden ducks before that.

5.title: EU nations paying for Russian gas in rubles must be penalised: Poland
5.article_body: Poland's Climate Minister Anna Moskwa said that the European Union should penalise countries that use rubles to pay for Russian gas. This comes after Russia's energy firm Gazprom on Wednesday halted gas exports to Poland and Bulgaria over the countries' refusal to pay for supplies in Russian currency. Reportedly, four European gas buyers have paid for supplies in rubles.

6.title: Meta reports 21% drop in profits in 2nd straight quarterly decline
6.article_body: Facebook parent Meta reported a 21% y-o-y decline in its profit for Q1 2022 at $7.5 billion, marking the company's second consecutive quarterly decline. Meta's revenue however grew 7% to $27.91 billion from $26.17 billion. Meanwhile, Facebook's daily active user count also increased 4% y-o-y to 1.96 billion after declining in Q4 2021 for the first time.

7.title: UP villagers thrash leopard to death after it attacks people in fields
7.article_body: Villagers in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich thrashed a leopard with sticks and killed it after it attacked some people working in the fields. Thirteen people, including three women were injured in the incident. Some villagers also attacked the forest officials who had come to catch the leopard. An official said they are trying to identify the villagers who attacked the staff.

8.title: BJP claims 8 of the top 10 states with highest fuel prices are non-BJP ruled states
8.article_body: BJP has shared a list claiming that eight of the top 10 states with highest petrol and diesel prices in the country are non-BJP ruled states. According to BJP, Andhra Pradesh occupies the top spot where petrol was sold at ₹121.4/litre and diesel at ₹107/ litre on April 6. Madhya Pradesh and Bihar are also included in the list.

9.title: I've practiced choosing balls, bowlers to attack in death overs: Tewatia
9.article_body: GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia has revealed that since getting the finisher's role in IPL, he has practiced choosing bowlers and balls to attack during the death overs. Against SRH, Tewatia came in to bat when GT were 122/3 and needed 74 runs to win off 40 balls. He then scored 40*(21) to help his side chase down the 195-run total.

10.title: Staff preoccupied, not available for demolition drive: Delhi Police
10.article_body: The Delhi Police on Thursday wrote to the South Delhi Municipal Corporation stating the officials were preoccupied to assist SDMC staff in carrying out an anti-encroachment drive in Sarita Vihar. "It is requested that prior intimation of at least 10 days may be given to fix the date for encroachment removal drive in the area," Delhi Police said.

11.title: Chhattisgarh govt to celebrate 'Mati Poojan Diwas' to promote natural farming
11.article_body: Chhattisgarh government announced on Wednesday that it will celebrate 'Mati Poojan Diwas' on May 3 to promote natural farming. According to a government circular, farmers and people would be encouraged to use vermicompost, cow urine and organic fertilisers instead of chemical ones. The programmes will be held at various panchayat levels as well as on the state level in Raipur.

12.title: 8 months' GST compensation sent to states, ₹78,704 cr pending: Govt
12.article_body: Finance Ministry on Wednesday said the Centre has released eight months of GST compensation for FY22 to states and compensation worth ₹78,704 crore is pending due to inadequate balance in the cess fund. During GST's implementation in 2017, Centre had agreed to compensate states till June 2022. It added that ₹7.35 lakh crore has been released to compensate revenue loss.

13.title: Actor Salim Ghouse passes away aged 70 due to cardiac arrest
13.article_body: Film and TV actor Salim Ghouse passed away aged 70 in Mumbai after suffering cardiac arrest. The last rites of the actor were performed early on Thursday morning. Ghouse started his acting journey in 1978 with the movie 'Swarg Narak', following which he featured in films like 'Chakra' and 'Saaransh'. He also featured in the TV show 'Bharat Ek Khoj'.

14.title: What are the highest targets achieved in the 20th over in IPL?
14.article_body: GT on Wednesday successfully chased down 22 runs required to win off the 20th over. It's the second-highest target achieved in the 20th over in IPL. RPS successfully chased down 23 runs off the last over against PBKS in IPL 2016 to record the highest target achieved in last over. Deccan Chargers, MI and RCB have chased down 21 runs.

15.title: Sleep with me or I'll get 20 more men: Russian soldier to pregnant teen before raping her
15.article_body: A 16-year-old pregnant girl in Ukraine's Kherson has revealed that she was threatened by a Russian soldier before he raped her. "When I resisted, he strangled me and said he'll kill me. Then he issued an unimaginable threat. He said either you sleep with me now, or I will bring 20 more people." the girl said.

16.title: Twitter-Musk deal includes $1 billion termination fee for both the parties
16.article_body: Elon Musk will have to pay Twitter a fee of $1 billion if he terminates his $44 billion cash deal for the social media company, according to a regulatory filing. Twitter will have to pay the same fee under specified circumstances if it terminates the deal. The deal could be terminated if not closed by October 24, the filing added.

17.title: Only 2 people have quit our tech team in 10 years: Zerodha's CTO
17.article_body: Unicorn startup Zerodha's CTO Kailash Nadh told Moneycontrol, "We have a technology team of just 33 people." He added, "Only two people have quit tech team in 10 years...that too for personal reasons." He explained, "We've kept it really simple, grounded and realistic...Aspirants are usually sold a vision about changing the lives of billions of people, we don't do that."

18.title: PL launches scheme to aid progress of South Asian football players
18.article_body: The Premier League has launched a scheme to aid the progress of young football players with South Asian backgrounds. It aims to improve coaching, playing and executive pathways for Asian, black and minority ethnic groups. Data from the Professional Footballers' Association shows there are 16 professional footballers with British South Asian heritage in the top four tiers of English football.

19.title: Andaman & Nicobar to get renewable energy-based power supply project
19.article_body: The central government will set up a renewable energy-based power supply project in Andaman and Nicobar Islands. The centre had signed a grant agreement with the Japan International Cooperation Agency to provide loan of $133 million in March for the same. The project, which will help in reducing the islands' carbon footprint, is expected to be completed by February 2024.

20.title: 2 Indian-origin men get jail for lying about vaccine status in Singapore
20.article_body: A Singapore court sentenced two Indian-origin men to five days in prison after one of them lied about his vaccination status to enter a bar. One of the accused, identified as 65-year-old Utheyakumar Nallathamby, had impersonated the other co-accused as he was unvaccinated and used the latter's credentials to enter bar. Nallathamby was caught after bar's assistant manager spotted him.

21.title: RCB share pics from ethnic-themed wedding party for Glenn Maxwell, Vini Raman
21.article_body: RCB took to Instagram to share pictures from ethnic-themed wedding party for Glenn Maxwell and Vini Raman. "Wedding vibes at the RCB camp last evening as we got together to celebrate #MaxiVins with a nice touch of Indian tradition," RCB wrote. The duo got married last month. Vini is an Indian-origin pharmacist based in Melbourne.

22.title: Praying for the safety of our Muslim brothers & sisters in India: German footballer Özil
22.article_body: German footballer Mesut Özil took to Twitter and wrote, "Praying during...holy night of Lailat al-Qadr for safety and well-being of our Muslim brothers and sisters in India." He added, "Let's spread awareness to this shameful situation! What is happening to the human rights in the so-called largest democracy in the world? #BreakTheSilence."

23.title: Finland and Sweden could join NATO quickly: Stoltenberg
23.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said Finland and Sweden will be able to join the military alliance "quickly" if they apply for membership. NATO would also try to find ways to ensure the two countries' security from the time they apply until they formally join, he added. Russia has threatened to deploy nuclear weapons to Baltics if the countries join NATO.

24.title: Congress leader Kamal Nath resigns as Leader of Opposition in MP
24.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath has resigned as the Leader of Opposition in Madhya Pradesh. Nath's resignation has been accepted by the Congress high command, All India Congress Committee General Secretary KC Venugopal said. Dr Govind Singh will be the Leader of the Congress Legislature Party in Madhya Pradesh, the Congress party said.

25.title: Sister asked 'Are you still in the film': Taapsee on working with SRK in Dunki
25.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu spoke about signing 'Dunki' alongside Shah Rukh Khan. She said, "It's too good to be true. I never...thought that I'll...someday reach this, forget about so soon." Taapsee revealed not just her, even her sister, Shagun Pannu, couldn't believe it. "Each time I went for [any] meeting with Rajkumar (Hirani)...she asked me, 'Are you still in the film'?"

26.title: Don't want to give her any importance: Ali Merchant on ex-wife Sara Khan
26.article_body: After Ali Merchant's ex-wife Sara Khan blamed him for her early eviction from 'Lock Upp', Merchant said, "[There were] claims that I was on the show because of her, well, tables have turned. Now she needs me to get the limelight." "I don't even want to give her any importance as it's not worth it," he added.

27.title: Liverpool’s Klopp hails ‘world class’ Mane after CL win over Villarreal
27.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp hailed forward Sadio Mane after the Senegalese scored to help Liverpool beat Villarreal in their Champions League semi-final first-leg clash on Wednesday. "He can play left, he can play central, both positions world class," Klopp said. Mane, 30, has scored 20 goals in 44 appearances for Liverpool so far this season.

28.title: It's easy to be politically neutral: Billionaire Cuban to Musk
28.article_body: Billionaire investor Mark Cuban in response to Elon Musk's comment on making Twitter "politically neutral" said, "It's easy to be politically neutral. It's hard to be neutral about health and safety issues." Earlier, Musk said that to "deserve" the public's trust, Twitter "must be politically neutral". He added that it "effectively means upsetting the far-right and...far-left equally".

29.title: Russia-Ukraine war could last as long as 10 years: UK
29.article_body: United Kingdom's Foreign Secretary Liz Truss has said that the Russia-Ukraine war could last as long as 10 years. She further said that if Russian President Vladimir Putin succeeds "there will be untold further misery across Europe and terrible consequences across the globe". Truss in her speech called Putin a "desperate rogue operator".

30.title: 'Avatar 2' to release on Dec 16, film's footage screened at CinemaCon
30.article_body: The release date of James Cameron's 'Avatar: The Way of Water' has officially been announced at CinemaCon 2022. The film, which will be a sequel to the 2009 film 'Avatar', will release on December 16. Two scenes of the upcoming film were shown at the CinemaCon. 'Avatar: The Way of Water' will feature Sam Worthington and Zoe Saldana.

31.title: I'm concerned but not overly: Deep Dasgupta on Rohit and Virat's form
31.article_body: On being asked if Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's form in the ongoing IPL season is a matter of concern, Deep Dasgupta said, "I'm not overly concerned...because it's different when you play for your country and when you play for franchises." In IPL 2022, Kohli has scored 128 runs in nine games while Rohit has scored 153 in eight matches.

32.title: South Korea to send gas to Europe amid energy crisis: Report
32.article_body: South Korea has decided to share liquefied natural gas (LNG) with European countries amid the energy crisis owing to restricted supply of Russian gas over Ukraine war, a report said quoting government officials. The country has the capability for providing such support in spring, however, the volume of shipment will "not be that much", according to an official.

33.title: Kohli got inner edges that missed the stumps vs RR, it's a worry: Bhogle
33.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle said Virat Kohli got inner edges that missed the stumps during his knock of 9 off 10 balls in RCB's defeat by 29 runs against RR, which is a worry. "Kohli is just not able to get away in the powerplay," added Bhogle. "Keep backing him and hope that at some point the fine-tuning happens," stated Bhogle.

34.title: There's no area in Kashmir that is free from militancy: Omar Abdullah
34.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir is passing through a difficult phase, Omar Abdullah, former Jammu and Kashmir CM, said on Thursday. "The security situation is a cause of concern. There's no area in Kashmir that is free from militancy," Abdullah added. "There is very little economic activity, barring tourism. Jammu and Kashmir has high unemployment levels," Abdullah stated.

35.title: 18-year-old boy develops AI, sensor-based bicycle counter in B'luru
35.article_body: Bengaluru-based 18-year-old boy, Nihar Thakkar, has developed an artificial intelligence and sensor-based bicycle counter, which is said to be the first in India. The counter has been installed in Doddanekundi. He said, "[It's] powered by an AI-sensor camera and a machine learning-based algorithm where the data provided can be used to encourage cycling and to build more dedicated cycle lanes."

36.title: Indonesia export ban traps 2.9 lakh tonnes of palm oil for India: Report
36.article_body: Indonesia's palm oil export ban has trapped at least 2.9 lakh tonnes of palm oil shipments headed to India, Reuters reported citing industry officials. The widening of Indonesia's export ban and the consequent shipment disruptions will create vegetable oil shortage in India, the officials added. This comes shortly after India faced sunflower oil import shortages due to the Russia-Ukraine war.

37.title: 12-yr-old girl complains of back pain in UK, X-ray shows spine curved at 80-degree angle
37.article_body: A 12-year-old girl who complained about shoulder and back pain has been recommended urgent surgery by doctors in UK after an X-ray revealed her spine was curved at an 80-degree angle. The girl's mother said that the 12-year-old had rapid onset progression scoliosis. "If the bend starts going even further it can start crushing her lungs and heart," she added.

38.title: 1 in 5 reptiles found worldwide is threatened with extinction: Study
38.article_body: One-fifth of the reptile species found worldwide are threatened with extinction, a study stated. Out of the 10,196 reptile species examined, 21% are critically endangered, endangered or vulnerable to extinction as defined by International Union for Conservation of Nature. The threatened species include Galapagos tortoises, Indonesia's Komodo dragon, Africa's rhinoceros viper, India's gharial etc.

39.title: 12-yr-old B'deshi boy, who unknowingly entered India, reunited with family
39.article_body: A 12-year-old Bangladeshi boy, who unknowingly entered the Indian territory, was reunited with his family on Wednesday. The boy had entered India while sleeping in an Indian export truck that was parked in the area where he was playing with other children in Bangladesh. He was handed over to Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) following paperwork, a BSF official said.

40.title: Russia says it will wait & see how Musk's ownership affects Twitter
40.article_body: Russian spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said on Thursday that Russia will wait and see how billionaire Elon Musk's ownership of Twitter will affect the platform. He also said that he doubted Western social media's capability to reflect different points of view. The statement comes as a Russian court reportedly fined Twitter $41,000 for not removing banned content from its site.

41.title: Probe into Bible-in-school row hurtful: Bengaluru Archbishop
41.article_body: Reacting to the probe ordered by the Karnataka government into the Bible row in the state, Bengaluru's Archbishop Peter Machado said, "I feel very hurt." "No student of any other religion had converted while studying in Christian schools," he added. He further said non-Christian students were not required to read the Bible and no Bible instructions were issued for them.

42.title: SSB Jawan blackmails, rapes 24-yr-old woman in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
42.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police have booked a Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) jawan for allegedly raping a 24-year-old woman in Lakhimpur Kheri. The woman alleged that the jawan took her photos while she was bathing and also recorded a video of her in the bathroom. He blackmailed her and forced her to have sexual relations with him, she claimed in her complaint.

43.title: Panchkula woman trying to book chopper tickets online cheated of ₹2.2 lakh
43.article_body: A Panchkula resident was cheated of ₹2.2 lakh by a fraudster while trying to book a helicopter ride for Char Dham Yatra with her family. The complainant said she came across a website and submitted her contact details there. "We were told to pay 50% of ticket charges in advance and remaining amount two days before chopper ride," she stated.

44.title: Will wait for NTAGI's suggestion to vaccinate 5 to 12-year-olds: Govt
44.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Thursday said the Centre will wait for National Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation's (NTAGI) recommendation to begin vaccination of 5-12-year-olds. This comes after Biological E's Corbevax and Bharat Biotech's Covaxin received emergency use authorisation for children aged 5-12 and 6-12 respectively. Vaccination for minors in India began on January 3.

45.title: If Pant is an MS Dhoni fan, he should learn from him: Virender Sehwag
45.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said DC captain Rishabh Pant should learn from former CSK captain MS Dhoni, if he is a fan of Dhoni. "Pant has the ability to score 20-25 runs in the final over, but for that he has to be at the crease," added Sehwag. Pant has scored 188 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

46.title: 33-yr-old BSF constable shoots himself dead in Chhattisgarh's Kanker
46.article_body: A 33-year-old Border Security Force (BSF) constable allegedly died by suicide by shooting himself with his service weapon in Chhattisgarh's Kanker, police said. The incident took place on Thursday morning at the BSF camp in Kamtera, police added. "On hearing the gunshot, his colleagues rushed to the spot and found him lying dead in a pool of blood," police stated.

47.title: US is 'out of pandemic phase' of COVID-19: Anthony Fauci
47.article_body: Top US health expert Dr Anthony Fauci said the US is "out of the pandemic phase" of COVID-19. "We are much, much better off than we were a year ago," Fauci said. "There's a lot of viral dynamics throughout the world and we still may get another variant which could lead to another potential surge," he added.

48.title: Air India's four Boeing 747 jets used for VIP travel deregistered
48.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has deregistered four Boeing 747 jumbo jets of Tata-owned Air India. DGCA said if Air India wants to use these aircrafts again for commercial flights, they'll have to undergo a return-to-service programme for re-registration. Till about two years ago, these 30-year-old jets were being used by the President, Vice President and Prime Minister.

49.title: Weren't told one religion will get preferential treatment in India: Omar
49.article_body: National Conference Vice President Omar Abdullah said, "When we decided to accede to India, we acceded to a country where every religion would be treated equally. We were not told that one religion will get preferential treatment and others will be suppressed." He added that decision perhaps would have been different if people knew about it.

50.title: Delhi's Benito Juarez Marg underpass to be opened in May: Sisodia
50.article_body: Benito Juarez Marg underpass will be opened to the public next month, Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said after he reviewed work on the stretch near South Campus. Once completed, the 1.8 km-long underpass is expected to provide relief to nearly 2.5 lakh commuters and travel to the airport and Gurugram will become smooth and traffic-free.

51.title: Sex racket operating in guise of spa busted in Delhi; 7 arrested
51.article_body: A sex racket that was being operated in the guise of a spa and massage parlour has been busted in Delhi's East Patel Nagar, police said on Wednesday. After receiving a tip-off, police carried out a raid at the massage parlour, 'The Space Spa', and arrested seven persons, including five women. Police have also recovered obscene material from the spot.

52.title: Pune ZP primary education dept to give 15% fee waiver to students
52.article_body: The primary education department of Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) on Tuesday issued a notification stating that it will implement a 15% fee waiver for the academic year 2021-22 across all schools under its jurisdiction. Additionally, schools cannot halt online classes for a child if their parents were unable to pay the fees during the pandemic, an official said.

53.title: Had bad relationship after Romiit Raaj, realised I'm happy single: Shilpa Shinde
53.article_body: Television actress Shilpa Shinde, who was engaged to actor Romiit Raaj a few years ago said she realised she is happy being single. "After my engagement broke off...I did get into another relationship...that was very bad experience...I've realised I am happy being single...If someone asks me...where I am going or what I am doing...I can't keep answering him," she added.

54.title: SC upholds 6 years minimum age condition for Class 1 admissions in KVs
54.article_body: The Supreme Court rejected pleas challenging the raising of the minimum age required for admissions to Class 1 in Kendriya Vidyalayas to six years. The new rule will be applicable from 2022-2023 academic year. Earlier, the Delhi High Court had upheld the move by Kendriya Vidyalaya Sangathan, after which some parents took it up with the apex court.

55.title: Staff not available for anti-encroachment drive: Delhi Police to SDMC
55.article_body: Delhi Police on Thursday wrote to South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) stating that its staff is preoccupied and not available for the anti-encroachment drive in one of its wards. "It's requested that prior intimation of at least 10 days may be given to fix the date for encroachment removal drive in the area of Sarita Vihar Police Station," police added.

56.title: Ben Stokes named England's new Test captain
56.article_body: All-rounder Ben Stokes has been appointed captain of England's Test team by the England & Wales Cricket Board. Stokes succeeds Joe Root in becoming the 81st captain of England's Test team. "I am honoured to be given the chance to lead the England Test team. This is a real privilege and I’m excited about getting started this summer," Stokes said.

57.title: Funding for football in India drops by almost 85% in 4 years due to poor performance
57.article_body: The government has slashed its funding to the All India Football Federation (AIFF) by almost 85% over the last four years, citing 'poor performance' of the team. AIFF has seen its grants under Annual Calendar of Training and Competitions (ACTC) fall from ₹30 crore for 2019-20 to ₹10 crore in 2020-21 and further down to ₹5 crore this year.

58.title: Malaika Arora shares pic showing scar on her forehead after car accident
58.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora took to Instagram Stories to share a picture which shows a scar on her forehead. The actress had met with a car accident on April 2 and was taken to the hospital after she received an injury near her eye. Earlier, speaking about the accident, she had said, "I was in shock...There was too much blood."

59.title: He taught for 50 yrs, doesn't own land: Padma Shri awardee's daughter on eviction
59.article_body: The daughter of 91-year-old Odissi dancer Guru Mayadhar Raut, who was evicted by Centre from bungalow allotted on rent in Delhi's Asiad village in the 1980s, said she was serving lunch when officials arrived. "This is how brutally you treat this legend. He taught in Delhi for 50 years, and doesn't own an inch of land anywhere," said Madhumita Raut.

60.title: Human activity is leading to more disasters: UN report
60.article_body: Human activity is leading to an increase in number of disasters worldwide, a new UN report released on Tuesday stated. According to the report, between 350 and 500 medium-sized to major disasters were recorded annually over the last two decades. Humans have put themselves into a spiral of self-destruction by heating up the climate and ignoring risks, the report stated.

61.title: Plane's tyre bursts while landing in B'luru; 150 passengers escape unhurt
61.article_body: Around 150 passengers onboard a Thai Airways plane escaped unhurt after the airplane suffered a tyre burst ​while landing at Bengaluru airport on Tuesday. The ground staff informed the flight's pilot about the faulty tyre, following which, he manoeuvred the plane into a safe landing. Subsequently, the scheduled departure of the flight from Bengaluru to Bangkok on Wednesday was cancelled.

62.title: Don't feel for me: Parag on entrepreneur's 'I feel for Twitter CEO' tweet
62.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal responded to an entrepreneur who had tweeted, "I feel for the current CEO of Twitter - he had all these plans and now lives with the same uncertainty of his whole team." Responding to entrepreneur Suhail Doshi, Agrawal tweeted, "Thank you but don't feel for me...What matters most is the service and the people improving it."

63.title: 7 IndiGo pilots found abusing over low salary on emergency frequency: Report
63.article_body: At least seven IndiGo pilots were allegedly found using offensive language on a frequency used for emergency communications, PTI reported. On April 9, these pilots were allegedly found using abusive language over low salaries on 121.5 MHz frequency, which is used for emergency communications only for the aircraft in distress. The DGCA has reportedly launched a probe in the matter.

64.title: 26 series were being shot when I was in Bhopal, no actor is out of work: Nawaz
64.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said that the quality of web series is even worse than that of television serials but no actor is out of work these days. He said that everyone is busy and that it is a good thing. "I remember that I was shooting in Bhopal and 26 series were being shot there simultaneously," he added.

65.title: US President Joe Biden to visit South Korea, Japan in May
65.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Wednesday said President Joe Biden will travel to South Korea and Japan next month over China's growing influence in the region and new threats from nuclear-armed North Korea. Biden will separately meet with South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol and Japanese Prime Minister Kishida Fumio during his trip from May 20 to 24.

66.title: MP Mahua criticises Decathlon, says 'store insists I give my number to buy pants for dad'
66.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra complained about Decathlon store in Delhi and tweeted, "Want to buy my dad trousers for ₹1499 in CASH at Decathlon India...& manager insists I need to put in my mobile number & email ID to purchase." Stating that Decathlon is violating privacy and consumer laws, Moitra tweeted, "The sweet manager finally put in his number."

67.title: North Delhi Municipal Corporation fined ₹50 lakh over Bhalswa landfill fire
67.article_body: Delhi government on Thursday imposed a fine of ₹50 lakh on North Delhi Municipal Corporation in connection with the fire that broke out at Bhalswa landfill site. Notably, some areas of the landfill are still burning on Thursday and fire tenders are present at the site. A massive fire broke out at the Bhalswa landfill on Tuesday evening.

68.title: Endangered male tiger put to sleep due to chronic back issue in UK
68.article_body: An endangered male tiger, named Vladimir, was put to sleep after a "chronic back problem suddenly worsened" at the Yorkshire Wildlife Park in the UK. The park said the "sad decision" was made by vets on Tuesday and that he would be "dearly missed". He was one of three Amur Tigers who arrived at the park 10 years ago.

69.title: Ace your preparation strategy with your trusted partner : Pearson
69.article_body: Whether aiming for higher studies or better jobs in the future, Indian learners today demand a world-class learning experience that accelerates their career pathways, said Pearson. Aligning to the idea, the brand has launched a new brand film on 'Preparation' featuring Vicky Kaushal. The film talks about how experts like Pearson can make the preparation process convenient and accessible.

70.title: Russian fleet in Black Sea still has ability to strike Ukraine: UK
70.article_body: Britain's Ministry of Defence on Thursday said Russia's fleet in the Black Sea still has the ability to strike Ukraine despite losing its landing ship Saratov and cruiser Moskva. The ministry said around 20 Russian Navy ships, including submarines, are currently in the operational zone of the Black Sea. It added that the Bosphorus Strait remains closed to non-Turkish warships.

71.title: PMPML to increase EV charging stations as more e-buses join fleet
71.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) is set to increase number of electric vehicle (EV) charging stations as more e-buses join its fleet. The EV charging station at Wagholi will have 35 charging points that can charge up to 70 e-buses simultaneously, PMPML chairman said. PMC is also likely to set up charging stations at Pune station and Bibwewadi depots.

72.title: India-Japan ties have deepened in every sphere in 70 years: PM Modi
72.article_body: On the 70th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between India and Japan, PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said that the ties between the two countries have deepened in every sphere. The recent visit to India by Japanese PM Fumio Kishida laid out a roadmap for deepening the Special Strategic and Global Partnership in a post-COVID-19 world.

73.title: Nawazuddin Siddiqui, 4 family members get clean chit in minor's molestation case
73.article_body: A special POCSO (Protection of Children from Sexual Offences) court in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar has given a clean chit to actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui and four of his family members in a molestation case. According to the prosecution, Siddiqui's brother Minazuddin had allegedly molested a minor family member in 2012, while the other family members had supported him.

74.title: Switzerland implements new EU sanctions against Russia, Belarus
74.article_body: The Swiss government on Wednesday said it has implemented new EU sanctions against Russia and Belarus. The sanctions include an import ban on coal, timber, caviar and seafood which are seen as important sources of revenue for Russia. Exports of banknotes and sales of securities in all EU currencies to Belarusian nationals and residents is also banned.

75.title: I can dream of becoming UP CM again or PM but not country's President: Mayawati
75.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Thursday said SP is responsible for BJP's win in UP in the recent Assembly polls. "I can dream of becoming UP CM again or the PM but not the President of the country," Mayawati added. "SP is dreaming of making me country's President so that their path to the UP CM post is clear," Mayawati stated.

76.title: Waste pickers assaulted for dancing in religious procession in Pune
76.article_body: Two waste pickers were allegedly assaulted for dancing in a public religious procession (jatra) in Pune's Jejuri. The victims alleged that casteist remarks were made against them for dancing with the other public from the village. Following their complaint, police have launched an investigation and have booked two men under the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.

77.title: Video of Johnny Depp drawing during his defamation trial goes viral
77.article_body: A video of Johnny Depp doodling during his defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard has gone viral on social media. In the video, Depp can be seen drawing a picture on a notepad while LAPD officer Tyler Hadden testified in court over the incident that took place in May 2016. Later, Depp was seen showing his doodle to his attorney.

78.title: Music should be heard rather than be seen: Aamir on releasing 'Kahani' on radio
78.article_body: Aamir Khan unveiled a song titled 'Kahani' from his upcoming film, 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. Aamir said he released the song on a radio station because a song deserves to be heard than just be seen with the help of visuals. Speaking about the song, he said, "I...believe that the songs in 'Laal Singh Chaddha' are the soul of the film."

79.title: Germany top buyer of Russian energy since invasion began: Study
79.article_body: A study published by the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air (CREA) shows that Germany has been the top buyer of Russian energy since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. The CREA said Russia has earned €63 billion from fossil fuel exports of which Germany has paid about €9.1 billion since February 24.

80.title: Especially inappropriate: Kasparov on Djokovic supporting Russian players
80.article_body: Reacting to world number one men's tennis player Novak Djokovic's support for Russian players, ex-Russian chess grandmaster Garry Kasparov tweeted, "Russian athletes who don't condemn Putin...are supporting [him]. A [Serbian] failing to do so is especially inappropriate." "I personally believe there is no need to suspend Russian players. Competing is their right," Djokovic had earlier said.

81.title: Reels hard to monetise despite being popular: Zuckerberg
81.article_body: Reels account for over 20% of the time that users spend on Instagram, but they're hard to monetise for now, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said during the company's Q1 2022 earnings call. He added that currently AI recommendations are driving more of user feeds than social content. This will unlock "interesting" content that users would've otherwise missed, he noted.

82.title: We're all going to die some day, nuclear strike more probable: Russian TV host
82.article_body: Amid war with Ukraine, Russian state TV host Margarita Simonyan has said that everything will end with a nuclear strike, adding, "To me, it's more probable than the other outcome." "We will go to heaven, while they (enemies) will simply croak...We're all going to die someday," she said. Simonyan further said that she thinks World War-III is more realistic.

83.title: 'Sooryavansham' appeals to people, they show it again and again: Abhishek
83.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan said there is something about his father and actor Amitabh Bachchan's movie 'Sooryavansham' that appeals to people. "Sooryavansham is one of the most successful films for the channel when it comes on satellite. They keep showing it again and again," he said, adding, "I think 20-21 years since its release, and it still comes on satellite television."

84.title: DC can send Shardul Thakur up the order: Virender Sehwag
84.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said he's concerned about DC's batting in IPL 2022. He added that Shaw and Warner need to play longer innings for DC to have the advantage. He further said, "You can send Shardul Thakur up the order. He hasn't been doing much with the ball...could maybe come up with useful contributions with the bat."

85.title: Police arrest 8 people for school teacher's murder in Bihar's Buxar
85.article_body: Bihar Police on Thursday arrested eight people in connection with the murder of a school teacher in Buxar. Saroj Singh, who was the main witness to his brother Chitranjan's murder, was killed on April 19. Saroj had reportedly refused to turn hostile in his brother's murder trial, following which two people were hired on contract to kill him, police said.

86.title: PM Modi lays foundation stones for healthcare, education projects in Assam
86.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid foundation stones for healthcare and education projects including a Veterinary College in Assam's Diphu, Degree College in West Karbi Anglong and Agricultural College in Kolonga on Thursday. He also addressed the public at the 'Peace, Unity and Development Rally' in Diphu and said, "Since 2014...difficulties in the North East are reducing, people are developing."

87.title: Global chipmakers evaluating sites in India for new plants: Govt
87.article_body: Some of the world's biggest chipmakers are evaluating locations in India for new plants, Communications, Electronics and IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw told Bloomberg Television. India is in discussion with some of the world's largest firms to attract them into the country. "India is right there squarely on their global plans whether it is Intel, GlobalFoundries," he added.

88.title: Lookout notice issued against Vijay Babu in rape case, suspected to be out of the country
88.article_body: Kerala Police has issued a lookout circular against Malayalam actor-producer Vijay Babu who's facing a rape case. Babu went into hiding after the police registered a case against him based on the complaint of a woman who had accused him of sexually abusing her several times in the last one and half months. Police suspect he's out of the country.

89.title: 2 more arrested in connection with Delhi's Jahangirpuri violence
89.article_body: Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested two more persons in connection with the Jahangirpuri violence that took place on April 16. Police said that while scanning CCTV cameras and mobile videos, they found one accused roaming around with the crowd with a sword during the violence. The other accused was found to be instigating the crowd during the violence, police added.

90.title: Facing my first shot: Jaya Prada on throwback picture from her 1st movie
90.article_body: Actress Jaya Prada took to Instagram to share a throwback picture. "Throwback pic...Me facing my first shot in my movie," she captioned the picture. Her fans took to the comments section to say that she looks beautiful. "Too gorgeous ma'am," one fan commented while the other said, "Pic is not clear but you are clear."

91.title: J&K Police disallows Ramadan's last Friday prayers at Jamia Masjid suspecting protest
91.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir government has decided not to allow last Friday prayers of Ramadan at Srinagar's Jamia Masjid this year, citing difficulty in managing huge congregation. "Traditionally, it is a huge congregation and it can easily spiral into an Azadi protest," a police officer said. On April 9, 'Azadi' slogans were raised inside the mosque after the Friday prayers.

92.title: Twitter's top lawyer Vijaya Gadde abused online after Musk's tweets target her
92.article_body: Twitter's top lawyer Vijaya Gadde is being targeted with abusive tweets after Elon Musk, who's buying Twitter for $44 billion, criticised a content decision of Twitter's legal team. On a user's tweet about Gadde, Musk criticised Twitter's 2020 decision to block a story about Hunter Biden. Musk also tweeted a meme about Twitter's alleged "left-wing bias", which featured Gadde.

93.title: Orange warning issued for 5 states/UTs as temperatures cross 45°C; list released
93.article_body: IMD scientist RK Jenamani on Thursday said that some parts of country recorded temperatures above 45°C yesterday, adding, "In view of this, we've announced an orange warning for Rajasthan, Delhi, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh and Odisha." IMD has warned about heatwave conditions over northwest and central India during the next five days and over east India during next three days.

94.title: DC players to wear special jersey against KKR tonight, share pics
94.article_body: The players of Delhi Capitals (DC) will wear a special jersey tonight in their IPL 2022 match against KKR. The special match shirts worn during the match will be auctioned off by the franchise. Every bid placed by a fan for the special match shirts will help raise funds for the Inspire Institute of Sport (IIS) Vijayanagar.

95.title: Wanted to start lingerie business 15 yrs ago, plan never saw light of day: Vineeta
95.article_body: Shark Tank India judge and SUGAR Cosmetics CEO Vineeta Singh wrote on LinkedIn that she wanted to start a lingerie business 15 years ago. She said, "That business plan never saw the light of day." She also wrote, "It's tough to build something. It's just a little bit tougher if you're building for women, with women as a woman."

96.title: Efforts on to remove entire northeast from AFSPA's ambit: PM Modi
96.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said the Centre is working to ensure that the entire northeast region is removed from the ambit of the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act (AFSPA). He said Meghalaya and Tripura were removed from AFSPA's ambit because there has been a 75% drop in violent incidents in the region in the last eight years.

97.title: SC to hold final hearing on pleas challenging sedition on May 5
97.article_body: The Supreme Court will hold the final hearing on pleas challenging constitutional validity of the sedition law under IPC Section 124A on May 5, a bench led by CJI N V Ramana said. The bench asked the Centre to submit its response by the end of the week, after which the petitioners will be allowed to file their counter.

98.title: UK minister accused of watching porn on mobile phone in parliament, probe on
98.article_body: A UK minister has been accused of watching porn on mobile phone while sitting alongside a female member in the country's parliament. The Conservative Party's chief whip has ordered an investigation into the allegations against the minister. The UK government's safeguarding minister Rachel Maclean said that she wants to see the minister "out of parliament and out of the party".

99.title: I'll do it one day: Umran on bowling 155 kmph delivery in IPL 2022
99.article_body: On being asked if he's targeting to hit 155 kmph with the ball in the ongoing IPL season, SRH pacer Umran Malik said, "God willing if I've to bowl 155, I'll do it one day." Umran, however, also added that he's only looking to bowl well in the tournament. The 22-year-old has picked 15 wickets in eight games so far.

100.title: Man throws acid on woman for rejecting marriage proposal in Bengaluru
100.article_body: A 27-year-old man in Bengaluru allegedly threw acid on a 24-year-old woman for rejecting his marriage proposal. The incident happened at the staircase of the victim's office building in Sunkadakatte on Thursday. The woman has reportedly sustained more than 25% burn injuries and is being treated at a hospital. Police have launched a manhunt to arrest the accused, Nagesh.

101.title: 2 crushed to death, 3 injured as cars collide on Pune-Solapur highway
101.article_body: Two persons died and three others were injured after two cars collided with each other near the Kavadi Pat toll plaza on the Pune-Solapur highway on Thursday, police said. The impact of the collision was so severe that both cars were badly damaged and people inside them were crushed, police added. Meanwhile, an investigation has been launched into the incident.

102.title: Furniture startup WoodenStreet raises ₹230 cr at ₹1,200 cr valuation
102.article_body: Online furniture and home decor platform WoodenStreet has raised ₹230 crore ($30 million) at a valuation of ₹1,200 crore, the Jaipur-based D2C company announced on Wednesday. The Series B funding round was led by WestBridge Capital. The company closed Series A funding of $3 million from IAN and Rajasthan Venture Capital Funds in 2020.

103.title: I had conspiracy theories: Hiddink on Chelsea's 2nd leg vs Barcelona in 2009
103.article_body: Discussing the second leg of Chelsea's Champions League semi-final against Barcelona in 2009, Guus Hiddink who was then Chelsea's interim manager said, "Some people argued it was fixed. I started to have a few conspiracy theories." Chelsea were knocked out of the Champions League on the basis of the away goals rule, after it ended 1-1 on aggregate.

104.title: 62 terrorists killed in encounters so far this year: IGP Kashmir
104.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Thursday said 62 terrorists have been killed in encounters so far this year. Out of these, 47 were local terrorists and 15 were foreign terrorists, said Inspector-General of Police (IGP), Kashmir, Vijay Kumar. While 39 of the total terrorists killed belonged to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), 15 were from Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM), he added.

105.title: Putin vows 'lightning-fast' response to any foreign interference in Ukraine
105.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned if any country interferes in the ongoing Ukraine conflict it'd be met with a "lightning-fast" military response from Moscow. "We have all the tools for this, things no one else can boast of having now. And we will not boast, we will use them if necessary. And I want everyone to know that," Putin said.

106.title: 91-year-old Odissi dancer evicted, Padma Shri citation seen lying on road in Delhi
106.article_body: Centre has started evicting artistes who were allotted bungalows on rent in Delhi's Asiad village in 1980s. On Tuesday, 91-year-old Odissi dancer Guru Mayadhar Raut was evicted and his Padma Shri citation was seen lying on road. His daughter Madhumita said, "I'm extremely hurt and broken today...He doesn't deserve to be thrown out like this. Every citizen deserves basic dignity."

107.title: Around 5,000 active cases in Delhi but severity going down: Satyendar Jain
107.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Wednesday said though the number of COVID-19 cases in the capital is increasing, its severity is going down. "There are around 5,000 active COVID cases in Delhi, but hospital admissions are very few, as the entire population of Delhi is vaccinated," he said. "We have 10,000 beds...If needed, we'll increase the number," he added.

108.title: Unfortunately in Maha, we don't have any 'yogis' but 'bhogis': Raj Thackeray
108.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray congratulated UP CM Yogi Adityanath for removing thousands of loudspeakers from religious places, "especially the masjids" in the state. "Unfortunately in Maharashtra, we don't have any 'yogis'; what we have are 'bhogis'. Here's hoping and praying good sense prevails," Thackeray said. UP government removed 10,900 "illegal" loudspeakers from religious places till Wednesday.

109.title: Ugly display of faith to harass others won’t be tolerated: UP CM Yogi
109.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said it won’t be tolerated if people indulge in an "ugly display" of their faith to harass others. "There is full respect for all the faiths, there is no interference by the state government in religious practices but common people shouldn't be harassed," he added. "We proved that UP can remain free of riots," he stated.

110.title: She hit me with metal rod: Rob Kardashian on 'toxic' relationship with Blac Chyna
110.article_body: Speaking about his relationship with ex-fiancée Blac Chyna, television personality Rob Kardashian said, "It wasn't...real...love or we'd have been married. I didn't want to be married to someone like that. It was a toxic relationship." Kardashian also revealed the alleged abuse where Chyna got violent and hit him with a six-foot metal rod and pointed an unloaded gun at him.

111.title: Hair Care Juice reduces hair fall on 93% of our users in 6 weeks: Kapiva
111.article_body: According to a study conducted among Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda's consumers, 93% claim they experienced less hair fall after using Hair Care Juice. The combination of Noni, Bhringraj, Ashwagandha & Amla stimulates scalp's bloodstream, replaces dead cells in hair follicles, and combats breakage & hair loss due to stress, Kapiva stated. Furthermore, 70% users experienced faster & newer hair growth.

112.title: Most pleasing thing about Umran is that he wants to learn, improve: Moody
112.article_body: Praising their pacer Umran Malik, SRH head coach Tom Moody said the most pleasing thing about the 22-year-old is that he wants to "learn and improve". Moody added, "Umran is still very new to this high-pressure cricket. I'm sure he'll gain more and more confidence in IPL." Umran picked a five-wicket haul against GT on Wednesday.

113.title: Hardik Patel not holding talks with us despite invitation: Gujarat Cong chief
113.article_body: Gujarat Congress chief Jagdish Thakor criticised Hardik Patel by saying that he is giving anti-party statements in the media and not making himself available to resolve the differences when invited for talks with party members. "I called him last week and again yesterday. Last time he said he was busy...Later, he said he was in Surat," Thakor said.

114.title: Karachi University suicide bomber's husband arrested
114.article_body: Security officials have arrested the husband of the 30-year-old woman who blew herself up at the University of Karachi in Pakistan on Tuesday. This is reportedly the first arrest in connection with the blast case. Four people, including three Chinese nationals, were killed and several others were injured in the blast claimed by the Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA).

115.title: A regional language is the most important: Karnataka CM on national language debate
115.article_body: Referring to Ajay Devgn and Kiccha Sudeep's argument over national language debate, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "What Sudeep said was correct...A regional language is the most important as a state is formed on linguistic bases." He added, "Everyone should understand and respect what Sudeep...said." Referring to KGF: Chapter 2's success, Sudeep said Hindi is "no more" a national language.

116.title: Sickening to see the violence against Muslims celebrated in India: Padma Lakshmi
116.article_body: Indian-American model and author Padma Lakshmi has tweeted, "Sickening to see violence against Muslims celebrated in India. The widespread anti-Muslim rhetoric...poisons people." "Fellow Hindus, don't succumb to this fear-mongering. There is no threat to Hinduism in India or anywhere else. People of all faiths should be able to live peacefully together in this ancient...land.," she wrote.

117.title: Teachers told my parents there's something wrong with me: Zerodha CEO
117.article_body: Zerodha's Billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath in an interview discussed his school days and said his teachers called his parents several times and told them that "there is something wrong with your son". Talking about taking up entrepreneurship Kamath said, "It was accidental." He added he quit his job at a call centre and started portfolio management.

118.title: CCI conducts raids against Amazon's 2 Indian sellers: Report
118.article_body: The Competition Commission of India has launched raids against two domestic Amazon sellers, Cloudtail and Appario, over alleged violation of competition laws, Reuters reported citing sources. The raids, being carried out in New Delhi and Bengaluru, are related to CCI's investigation ordered in January 2020. Earlier, Amazon had been accused of promoting preferred sellers on websites.

119.title: Haryana Police constable dies after accidentally firing his service rifle
119.article_body: A constable of Haryana Police died after he accidentally fired his service rifle at his house on Tuesday. The deceased, identified as Pitamber, reportedly came home late after duty and brought the rifle with him. Next day, he started cleaning the rifle, when it accidentally went off. Pitamber was rushed to the hospital where doctors declared him dead.

120.title: Tiger Shroff, Tara Sutaria visit temple, dargah ahead of Heropanti 2 release
120.article_body: Actors Tiger Shroff and Tara Sutaria visited Babulnath temple and Mahim dargah in Mumbai ahead of the release of their upcoming film, 'Heropanti 2'. Tara and Tiger carried a basket of flowers on their head as they entered the Mahim dargah. The duo donned ethnic attire as they sought blessings for the success of their forthcoming film 'Heropanti 2'.

121.title: 5 coal miners killed by gunmen in Afghanistan
121.article_body: Five coal miners were killed by unidentified gunmen in Afghanistan's Samangan province on Tuesday, according to media reports. The victims were said to be robbed before being shot by the attackers. The incident took place in the Kotal Regi area of the Dara-e-Sof district. All the victims were reportedly from the Hazara community.

122.title: Govt asks electric two-wheeler makers to halt new launches due to fire incidents: Reports
122.article_body: The government has asked electric two-wheeler manufacturers to halt new launches until EV fire incidents were investigated, reports said. The government has also cautioned manufacturers who did not have incidents to take corrective measures, reports added. The makers have also been asked to recall EVs from the particular batch of vehicles that the fires were reported on recently, reports stated.

123.title: Amazon permanently lifts ban on mobile phones in warehouses: Report
123.article_body: Amazon has permanently lifted the ban on mobile phones in warehouses allowing workers to keep mobile phones with them on the job, Bloomberg reported citing an internal email. "We recognise the desire for employees to keep their mobile phones...and...last two years have demonstrated that we can safely do so," it said. The new policy will be applicable worldwide.

124.title: Maha govt collected ₹79,412 cr as fuel taxes since 2018: Hardeep Puri
124.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri took to Twitter to question the Maharashtra government's decision to not reduce Value Added Tax (VAT) on fuel. "Maharashtra...collected ₹79,412 crore...fuel taxes since 2018 and is expected to collect ₹33,000 crore this year," he stated. "Why did it not reduce VAT on petrol...diesel to provide relief to people?" he added.

125.title: Coercive, not co-operative: Rahul on PM's fuel tax appeal to states
125.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said 68% of all fuel taxes is taken by the Centre, yet, PM Narendra Modi abdicates the responsibility. "High fuel prices - blame states, coal shortage - blame states, oxygen shortage - blame states...(PM) Modi’s federalism isn't cooperative. It’s coercive," Gandhi tweeted. His remark comes after PM Modi urged several states to cut VAT on fuel.

126.title: Maha Police seizes 89 swords from vehicle on Mumbai-Agra highway, 4 held
126.article_body: Maharashtra Police on Thursday seized 89 swords and one dagger from a Scorpio vehicle, on its way from Chittorgarh in Rajasthan, on the Mumbai-Agra highway in Dhule and arrested four men. There is no clarity on where the weapons were headed to, police said. BJP leader Ram Kadam questioned why swords from a Congress-ruled state were being brought to Mumbai.

127.title: Machine Gun Kelly & I consume each other's blood for ritual purposes: Megan Fox
127.article_body: Actress Megan Fox, speaking to Glamour magazine, opened up about she and her fiancé, singer Machine Gun Kelly, drinking each other's blood. "I guess to drink each other's blood might mislead people or people are imagining us with goblets...It's just a few drops, but yes, we do consume each other's blood on occasion for ritual purposes only," she stated.

128.title: Pooja Hegde is social media queen, what she posts has impact: Ram Charan
128.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said that actress Pooja Hegde is a social media queen and is good at it. "'Arabic Kuthu' was all over the place. We were shooting and...were waiting for next shot to set up and...I saw boys and girls...listening to 'Arabic Kuthu' and 'Butta Bomma'. It's coming out...in my Reels also...whatever Pooja posts makes an impact," he added.

129.title: Cong mute spectator to crimes against women in Rajasthan: Anurag Thakur
129.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday criticised Congress over 'rise in crime' against women in Rajasthan. "In Hathras, the way Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi came forward and Sonia Gandhi made incessant statements...Why have Sonia ji, Rahul ji and Priyanka ji turned mute spectators now?" Thakur asked. He also accused Congress of creating tensions among different communities in Rajasthan.

130.title: UN to send team to evacuate civilians from Mariupol steel plant
130.article_body: The United Nations said that it is sending an experienced team from the world over, in partnership with International Committee of the Red Cross, to evacuate people trapped in a steel plant in Ukraine's Mariupol. About 2,000 troops and 1,000 civilians are said to be trapped in bunkers below the damaged structure.

131.title: Mohali woman with blindfold after surgery loses purse to unidentified man
131.article_body: An unidentified man took away a woman’s purse while she was waiting in her daughter’s car, blindfolded after undergoing an eye operation at Mohali’s Sohana Hospital on Wednesday. The purse contained an iPhone, Apple Watch, ₹6,000, a pair of gold earrings and bangles, besides her PAN card, Aadhaar card, bank passbook and credit card, the victim’s daughter said.

132.title: Musk says Twitter needs to be politically neutral for public trust, explains what he means
132.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk, who recently announced that he would buy Twitter, has said, "For Twitter to deserve public trust, it must be politically neutral." He further explained that it effectively means "upsetting the far right and the far left equally". Earlier, Musk said that former US President Donald Trump's Truth Social exists because Twitter censored free speech.

133.title: Your ignorance is baffling: Ramya on Devgn's 'Hindi is national language' remark
133.article_body: Reacting to actor Ajay Devgn's 'Hindi was, is and will always be our national language' remark, actress-politician Divya Spandana, who is known as Ramya, tweeted, "No, Hindi is not our national language." She added, "Your ignorance is baffling. And it's great that films like KGF, Pushpa and RRR have done so well in Hindi belt...art has no language barrier."

134.title: 'KGF: Chapter 2' becomes third-highest grossing film in Hindi
134.article_body: 'KGF: Chapter 2' has become the third-highest grossing film in Hindi with a collection of ₹343 crore. It has beaten lifetime figures of Salman Khan's 'Tiger Zinda Hai' ( ₹339.16 crore), Aamir Khan's 'PK' (₹340.8 crore) and Ranbir Kapoor's 'Sanju' (₹342.53 crore). 'KGF: Chapter 2', which's originally made in Kannada, is inching towards the ₹1,000-crore mark at overall box office.

135.title: I once got angry at Pep Guardiola, we yelled in each other's faces: Aguero
135.article_body: Ex-Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero said he once got angry at Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola during a match against Tottenham Hotspur, with the two "yelling" in each other's faces. Discussing Guardiola's reaction after Riyad Mahrez missed a chance in the first leg of Manchester City's Champions League semi-final, Aguero stated he "doesn't like" Guardiola getting angry like that.

136.title: Elon Musk wins $13 bn suit over $2.6 bn Tesla-SolarCity deal
136.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has won a $13 billion lawsuit over Tesla's $2.6 billion acquisition of SolarCity, which Tesla shareholders had called a "bailout". They accused Musk of coercing Tesla's board into buying the struggling SolarCity, to rescue his investment. However, the US court found that Musk "was more involved in the process than a conflicted fiduciary should be".

137.title: BHU students burn VC's effigy in protest against Iftar party
137.article_body: In protest against the Iftar party organised by the Vice-Chancellor of Banaras Hindu University (BHU) on the campus, a group of students from the university burnt his effigy outside his residence on Wednesday. "VC is trying to impose a new tradition. This has never happened before in the university. He is trying to politicise the entire situation," a student said.

138.title: No load-shedding since a week in Maharashtra: MSEDCL chairman
138.article_body: Maharashtra has seen zero load-shedding for the last seven days, Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) chairman Vijay Singhal said. "We were able to meet the highest demand of 25,150 MW," he added. "We could generate additional hydro-power from the Koyna dam...has a capacity of around 100 TMC (thousand million cubic feet) for hydro-power generation," Singhal stated.

139.title: Need to prepare for 'short, swift wars': Indian Air Force chief
139.article_body: The current geopolitical situation necessitates Indian Air Force to prepare for intense and small duration operations at a short notice, Chief of Air Staff Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari has said. In an address at a seminar, he also said there would be a need for the force to prepare for "short, swift wars" and be ready for "long-drawn standoff".

140.title: Tomatoes thrown at French President Macron during 1st appearance after re-election
140.article_body: Tomatoes were thrown at French President Emmanuel Macron during his first appearance in public since his re-election on Sunday. Macron was greeting people following his victory when someone from the crowd hurled tomatoes at him. The tomatoes, however, missed the French President and hit one of his security guards, who shouted "projectile".

141.title: My 1st marriage may not have worked but I haven't become anti-men: Kanika
141.article_body: Speaking about her first marriage and how she has dealt with her divorce, singer Kanika Kapoor said that she decided to go out and work after her separation. When asked about her relationship with her ex-husband, Raj Chandok, Kanika said they're cordial with each other. "My first marriage may not have worked...but I've not become anti-love or anti-men," she added.

142.title: TMC has no future in Goa: Party's state chief resigns
142.article_body: Blaming poll strategist Prashant Kishor for the upset in Assembly elections, Goa TMC chief Kiran Kandolkar on Wednesday resigned from the party. The party has no future in Goa, he said. He added he had nothing against party chief Mamata Banerjee. "Prashant Kishor is the one who leads I-PAC. If anyone has failed, it is him," said Kandolkar.

143.title: PM called meet for COVID, taunted CMs of non-BJP states on fuel price: Raut
143.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut criticised PM Narendra Modi's appeal to CMs of non-BJP ruling states to reduce VAT on fuel and said PM Modi "taunted" the CMs. "The CMs were told that PM Modi would hold a meeting on COVID...(He) was not expected to do so but CM Uddhav Thackeray and Mamata Banerjee have given the answer," Raut added.

144.title: It's sent shiver down B'wood filmmakers' spine: Manoj on South films' success
144.article_body: Discussing the success of South films, actor Manoj Bajpayee said, "It has sent a shiver down the spine of all the mainstream filmmakers from the Mumbai film industry. They...don't know where to look." "This is a lesson for Mumbai industry's mainstream filmmakers on how to make mainstream cinema," added Manoj. "They don't dumb [their films]...down for the audience," stated Manoj.

145.title: It's happening so often that I fear we'll run out of luck in knockouts: Hardik
145.article_body: After their last-ball win against SRH, GT captain Hardik Pandya jokingly said "God is helping" them out in the ongoing IPL season. "I keep joking in the dressing room that God is telling us 'You guys are good, I'll help you'. It's happening so often that I fear we may run out of luck in the knockout games," he stated.

146.title: Man sleeping on roadside killed after being run over by SUV in Pune
146.article_body: A 37-year-old SUV driver has been arrested for allegedly running over and killing an elderly man sleeping on the roadside near Pune's Salisbury Park on April 20. The police arrested the accused, Anup Mehta, on Tuesday after going through CCTV camera footage. The driver told police that he wasn't able to see the man due to the vehicle's big bonnet.

147.title: People in Srinagar gather on streets to protest power crisis
147.article_body: Locals in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar gathered on the streets to protest the ongoing power crisis on Wednesday. They claimed they don't get electricity for three to four hours a day which has impacted the businessmen and industrial unitholders. "This is the first time we are witnessing such a scenario in Kashmir," said Tariq Mughloo, Vice-President, Kashmir Economic Alliance.

148.title: Army jawans booked after 3 J&K policemen get injured over dispute
148.article_body: Indian Army jawans were booked after three policemen were reportedly injured over a dispute related to some construction work in Jammu. The Army is said to have objected to the construction by a civilian family, who claimed to have permission for renovation work from the authorities. The policemen sustained injuries when they intervened. The Army denied the assault charge.

149.title: OnePlus 10R 5G, Nord CE 2 Lite 5G and Nord Buds set to be launched today
149.article_body: OnePlus presents 'More Power to You', unveiling its latest array of products across categories. The OnePlus 10R 5G will come with 150W SuperVOOC charge support and MediaTek Dimensity 8100 MA processor whereas the OnePlus Nord CE 2 Lite will feature a 64MP AI triple camera setup. The new OnePlus Nord Buds will sport 12.4 mm dynamic bass drivers.

150.title: TN reduced tax on petrol before Centre's action: State Finance Min
150.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to states to reduce VAT on fuel, Tamil Nadu's Finance Minister P Thiaga Rajan said that the Tamil Nadu government had reduced VAT on petrol back in August 2021, prior to the central government's action. "That cut resulted in a relief of ₹3/litre to the citizens of the state," the minister said.

151.title: RSS is like termite, spreading poison against society: Rajasthan Congress chief
151.article_body: Rajasthan Congress chief Govind Singh Dotasra on Wednesday said that the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) is like a "hidden termite" which is hollowing the society by spreading "poison". The Congress leader added that the RSS enjoys power behind the curtain and is not participating in direct politics to skirt accountability.

152.title: Centre owes Maha ₹26,500 cr, state not responsible for fuel price hike: Thackeray
152.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said the Centre owes the state ₹26,500 crore after PM Narendra Modi stated some states did not reduce VAT on petrol and diesel despite Union government's excise duty cut. The state is not responsible for the hike in fuel prices, he added. "Maharashtra's contribution in direct taxes collection at the national level is 38.3%," Thackeray stated.

153.title: My decision to work in a film will never be based on my character's age: Mrunal
153.article_body: Mrunal Thakur, who played the role of a mother in 'Jersey', said her decision to work in a film will never be based on her character's age. "It's dependent on [whether] the script resonates with me or how challenging it would be to play [an]...older version of myself," she added. "Make-up...doesn't help elevate the performances in such cases," she said.

154.title: Canada Parliament votes Russia's invasion of Ukraine as 'genocide'
154.article_body: Canadian lawmakers on Wednesday voted unanimously to call Russia's invasion of Ukraine a 'genocide'. The members of the Canadian House of Commons said there was "ample evidence of systemic and massive war crimes against humanity" being committed by Russia. The motion said war crimes by Russia include mass atrocities, systematic instances of willful killing of Ukrainian civilians, and rape.

155.title: Musk is revealing just how unserious a person he is: Ex-Twitter exec
155.article_body: Former Twitter executive Jason Goldman in an interview discussing Elon Musk's Twitter takeover said, "The company really could use great stewardship at this point and what he's revealing is just how unserious a person he is." He also criticised Musk's plan to relax speech restrictions, saying it "reveals a very naive and unserious approach to...content moderation issues he will face".

156.title: Man kills 8-month pregnant relative in Mumbai, foetus dies inside womb
156.article_body: An eight-month pregnant woman was murdered by her husband's cousin who was staying with them since a few months in Mumbai. An official said that the woman was found dead at her home and added that the foetus also died inside her womb. The reason for killing her has not yet been ascertained. Police have arrested the accused.

157.title: 2 former Karnataka CMs reply to Ajay Devgn's 'Hindi is our national language' tweet
157.article_body: Two former Karnataka Chief Ministers Siddaramaiah and HD Kumaraswamy have responded to Ajay Devgn's tweet directed at Kannada actor Sudeep, saying Hindi is our national language. Siddaramaiah said, "Hindi was never and will never be our national language. It's the duty of every Indian to respect linguistic diversity of our country." Kumaraswamy said, "India is a garden of several languages."

158.title: Nope! we're still here: Twitter CEO Parag after user says 'I thought we were fired'
158.article_body: Responding to a user who tweeted, "I thought we were fired," Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal wrote, "Nope! we're still here." Reacting to his reply, Twitter users wrote, "Hopefully, for not much longer," and "Better start looking now." Earlier, a report said Agrawal would receive $42 million if he's terminated within 12 months of a change in control at Twitter.

159.title: NCP leader Khadse's wife gets interim relief from arrest in land scam case
159.article_body: Bombay High Court on Wednesday granted interim relief from arrest till June 20 to NCP leader Eknath Khadse's wife Mandakini Khadse in connection with the 2016 Pune land scam case. "She is arraigned as an accused in the case lodged by ED in 2019," Mandakini's advocate said. Mandakini said that this is the only case against her.

160.title: Can't compare Bhagavad Gita with Bible and Quran: K'taka Education Minister BC Nagesh
160.article_body: After a Bengaluru school allegedly made Bible reading compulsory, Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said, "We can't compare Bhagavad Gita with Quran and Bible." He said, "Bible and Quran are religious texts. But Bhagavad Gita speaks about values needed to lead life." Earlier, Archbishop of Bengaluru questioned state government's plans to introduce Bhagavad Gita as the moral science syllabus.

161.title: RCB host Maxwell's wedding party, video of Kohli dancing on Pushpa song surfaces
161.article_body: RCB organised a wedding party in the bubble for newlyweds Glenn Maxwell and Vini Raman. A video of Virat Kohli dancing on Oo Antava song from movie 'Pushpa' at the wedding party has surfaced online. Anushka Sharma also shared pictures from the wedding party, writing, "I think I’ve seen and celebrated possibly every function and festival in a bubble!"

162.title: Proud of our people who are working with focus despite the noise: Twitter CEO
162.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Thursday said, "Proud of our people who continue to do the work with focus...despite the noise." Earlier, Agrawal told his employees, "There are no plans for any layoffs at this point." Recently, a report claimed that Twitter's General Counsel Vijaya Gadde cried in a meeting expressing concerns over Musk's takeover.

163.title: Exotic monkeys, wallaby rescued from 2 smugglers in Assam
163.article_body: Five exotic monkeys and a wallaby were rescued from two smugglers in Assam's North Kamrup on Wednesday. The accused were allegedly taking the caged animals to Hyderabad in a vehicle. One of the smugglers has been arrested, while the other managed to flee the spot, the forest department confirmed. The monkeys are believed to have been smuggled via Myanmar.

164.title: Corbett chief sacked, 2 IFS officers suspended over illegal construction
164.article_body: Uttarakhand government removed Rahul, the director of the Corbett Tiger Reserve and suspended two Indian Forest Service officers, JS Suhag and Kishan Chand from their posts on Wednesday. The High Court, in January, had directed to take action against the officials found guilty in the case of illegal constructions and felling of trees in the reserve's Pakhro and Morghati areas.

165.title: Liverpool defeat Villarreal to take 2-0 lead in Champions League semis
165.article_body: Liverpool defeated Villarreal 2-0 in the first leg of the Champions League semi-final. Liverpool's Jordan Henderson's deflected effort, which was ruled as Pervis Estupinan's own goal, opened the scoring while Sadio Mane doubled the lead in a two-minute span early in the second half. Liverpool are attempting to reach their third Champions League final in five years.

166.title: I won't say so: Anil on whether he is 'best friends' with Ranveer, Sanjay
166.article_body: Discussing whether he is 'best friends' with actors Ranveer Singh and Sanjay Dutt, actor Anil Kapoor said, "I won't say best friends. I am not so presumptuous that I am anybody's best friend." "I think we just respect...[and] love each other," added Anil. Anil and Ranveer starred together in the film 'Dil Dhadakne Do' which also featured Anushka Sharma.

167.title: I took this job to change Twitter for the better: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal
167.article_body: After Elon Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Thursday tweeted, "I took this job to change Twitter for the better, course correct where we need to, and strengthen the service." "Proud of our people who continue to do the work with focus and urgency despite the noise," he added.

168.title: Man dupes over 170 people in investment scam in Mumbai, booked
168.article_body: Mumbai police have booked a man for duping over 170 people on the pretext of an investment scam. According to an FIR, the complainant, son of Vastu consultant Biindu Khuraana, said his family had invested around ₹60 lakh in 2020. Though, they initially received good returns, months later, they stopped receiving the money following which they approached police.

169.title: 3 members of Punjab-based gang held for uprooting ATM in Kurukshetra
169.article_body: The Kurukshetra Police arrested three members of a Punjab-based gang for allegedly uprooting an ATM containing ₹18.41 lakh cash from Shahbad in Kurukshetra earlier this month. Two members of the gang are absconding. The accused uprooted the ATM with the help of an SUV and took it along on the intervening night of April 8 and 9.

170.title: Guj woman injured after husband wanting her to quit studies assaults her
170.article_body: A woman was injured in Gujarat's Rajkot after her husband, who wanted her to not pursue her further studies, assaulted her. He also stopped her from going to get her examination hall ticket. The woman reportedly pleaded with him to let her complete her second year, after which, she said she'd quit studies but the husband abused and assaulted her.

171.title: BMC completes 25% of pre-monsoon desilting work across Mumbai
171.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has completed 25% of pre-monsoon desilting work across Mumbai, senior civic officials said on Wednesday. The civic body further aims to complete about 65% of work by May 15. Moreover, BMC is also creating a website with real-time data on desilting work in order to maintain transparency between citizens and the civic body, officials said.

172.title: J&K's Mughal Road reopens after remaining closed for over 4 months
172.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's Mughal Road which connects Rajouri and Poonch districts of Jammu region with Shopian district of south Kashmir reopened for vehicular traffic on Wednesday. The road remained closed for over four months due to heavy snowfall in the area. Jammu's Divisional Commissioner ordered the reopening of the road, which was cleared of snow by the Mechanical Engineering Department.

173.title: Baidu, Pony.ai get 1st permits to deploy driverless robotaxis in China
173.article_body: Baidu and Pony.ai have received permits from Beijing city authorities to deploy their robotaxis without a safety driver, marking the first time such permits have been given in China. Both the firms are allowed to offer rides to the general public on open roads within a 60 square kilometre area in the Beijing Economic and Technological Development Area.
