174.title: Delhi govt to develop 'world-class' factory complex at Jhandewalan
174.article_body: Delhi government is planning to develop a 'world-class' factory complex at Jhandewalan, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said on Wednesday. "Development of conforming areas such as Jhandewalan will help the government generate employment opportunities by promoting labour intensive  manufacturing and service industrial activities," Sisodia said. The plan is a part of schemes announced under Rozgar Budget.

175.title: US & Russia swap prisoners amid Ukraine war tensions
175.article_body: The US and Russia on Wednesday swapped prisoners amid their most tense relations in decades over the Ukraine war. Ex-US Marine Trevor Reed, held in Russia since 2019, was exchanged for Russian pilot Konstantin Yaroshenko, who'd been serving a 20-year sentence for conspiring to smuggle cocaine into the US. Reed was jailed for assaulting two Russian police officers in Moscow.

176.title: Had a hole in my heart, blood clot travelled from that hole to my brain: Hailey
176.article_body: While talking about her hospitalisation in March, Hailey Bieber said that she experienced stroke-like symptoms from a "blood clot that traveled from a hole in her heart to her brain". Bieber added that tests revealed that she had a mini-stroke. She underwent a procedure to close the hole, which she says was between 12 and 13 millimetres.

177.title: 3 dead, 6 injured in Unnao after car overturns on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
177.article_body: At least three members of a family, including a six-month-old girl, were killed and six others were injured after a car overturned and was hit by another vehicle on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway, police said. The car was going to Gonda from Rajasthan and it jumped to the other lane and overturned before being hit by another car, police added.

178.title: UP has set an example by removing unnecessary loudspeakers: CM Yogi
178.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said the state has set an example before the country by removing unnecessary loudspeakers installed at religious sites or reducing their volumes across UP with harmony. "Instructions given for the use of loudspeakers should be implemented strictly. The people should not face inconvenience and loudspeakers should not be installed at new sites," CM Yogi added.

179.title: Umran Malik hurricane is blowing away everything in its way: P Chidambaram on SRH pacer
179.article_body: After SRH pacer Umran Malik's five-wicket haul against GT, Congress leader P Chidambaram tweeted, "The Umran Malik hurricane is blowing away everything in its way...The sheer pace and aggression is a sight to behold." Adding that Umran is the find of IPL 2022, Chidambaram suggested BCCI should give him an exclusive coach and "quickly" induct him into the national team.

180.title: I'm not in favour of Umran being included in India's T20 WC squad: RP Singh
180.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said he's not in favour of SRH pacer Umran Malik being included in India's squad for the 2022 T20 World Cup. "Umran is surely an exciting talent...But playing him right away? I'm not in favour...because he hasn't played much domestic and even in IPL, he has only just started to do well," explained Singh.

181.title: Why should govt suffer loss of face because of your negligence?: Mamata to police
181.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the state's police force saying that their "negligence" led to incidents of violence and rape. She said, "Why should the government have a loss of face because of your negligence?" This comes after nine people were burnt alive in Birbhum and a minor girl was allegedly raped by a TMC leader's son in Nadia.

182.title: Wrote poem for Big B, got letter he wrote next day: Runway 34 actress Aakanksha
182.article_body: 'Runway 34' actress Aakanksha Singh said that getting a handwritten letter from actor Amitabh Bachchan was a "very big deal" for her. She said she wrote a poem for the actor after he sent her a buggy when she had a fracture. "He had written...You will keep getting appreciation letters. But first, please accept this letter," Aakanksha added.

183.title: Improvised scene by putting nail paint on fingers: Nawazuddin on playing Laila
183.article_body: When asked if he was apprehensive about playing a feminine guy 'Laila' in 'Heropanti 2', actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said that he was looking for a role that is "villainous" and "feminine" at the same time. "There's a scene where I'm putting nail polish on my fingers, it wasn't a part of the script initially, but I improvised it," he added.

184.title: Feels good, happy to deliver against SRH: Rashid Khan on 31*(11)
184.article_body: GT's Rashid Khan, who smashed unbeaten 31 runs off 11 balls on Wednesday, said he's happy to deliver against SRH. He added, "[I'm] just trying to play my game and have that belief [in] my batting which I'm working [on] for the last two years." Rashid smashed three sixes in final over to help GT chase down SRH's 195-run total.

185.title: UK govt proposes seizing crypto assets to help against economic crime
185.article_body: The UK government has proposed seizing crypto assets to help combat economic crime. It told the parliament's Treasury Select Committee that the creation of a civil forfeiture power would "mitigate the risk posed by those that cannot be prosecuted but use their funds to further criminality". The parliamentary inquiry recommended creating a single body to tackle economic crime.

186.title: Skulls found by Mexican police from AD 900, not a crime scene
186.article_body: A pile of about 150 skulls found in a Mexico cave in 2012, which the police believed to be a crime scene, turned out to be over a thousand years old. According to archaeologists, the skulls belonged to sacrificial victims killed between AD 900 and 1200. They said the victims were likely decapitated and their skulls put on display.

187.title: Expel me if you want me to join BJP: Shivpal to Akhilesh
187.article_body: Reacting to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's remark that why was the BJP delaying induction of Shivpal Yadav, the latter said that if Akhilesh wanted him to join BJP then he should expel him from the party. "It's an irresponsible and childish statement. I'm one of 111 MLAs of SP who won in recent assembly elections," Shivpal said.

188.title: 36-yr-old property dealer held for killing 2 men in Prayagraj
188.article_body: A 36-year-old property dealer was arrested for allegedly killing two men involved in the sale and purchase of properties in Prayagraj's Dhoomanganj area on Wednesday, police said. The accused shot dead both the men after they had an argument over a property deal at the former's residence. The deceased and the accused were known to each other, police added.

189.title: UP govt removes 10,900 'illegal' loudspeakers from religious places
189.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government said it has removed 10,900 "illegal and unauthorised" loudspeakers from religious places across the state on Wednesday. "There's an existing 2018 order...there are set rules for sound decibel limits and court directions," it added. "Focus is to ensure the implementation of guidelines through dialogue, making everyone understand the norms through awareness," UP Police said.

190.title: Satyajit Ray did posters, music for films out of compulsion: Shoojit Sircar
190.article_body: Talking about late Indian filmmaker Satyajit Ray, director Shoojit Sircar said, "Ray is called a multi-talented director but this may be out of compulsion." "He [made] his own posters because probably he thought others won't realise it...the same way. Ray did music in his films as he wasn't sure...he could explain the context...in its entirety to another person," added Shoojit.

191.title: Mumbai court acquits builder, 4 police officials for planting drugs on agent
191.article_body: A special court acquitted a builder and four Mumbai Police officials, who were booked for planting drugs and a weapon on an estate agent. In 2004, 340 grams of heroin and a weapon were seized from the agent by Dongri Police. After the agent spent 150 days in jail, a probe revealed that he was falsely implicated by the accused.

192.title: 5 persons booked for attempted murder in Ludhiana after assaulting couple
192.article_body: Five persons were booked in Ludhiana for attempted murder after they assaulted a 23-year-old man and his wife with a baseball bat and a sword. The incident occurred on April 24, when the accused first assaulted the man over a verbal spat. Later, when his wife came to his rescue, the accused also assaulted her, according to the male complainant.

193.title: Astronauts launched by SpaceX reach International Space Station
193.article_body: The Crew-4 astronauts launched by SpaceX reached the International Space Station at 5:07 am IST on Thursday after a journey of nearly 16 hours. While three astronauts - Kjell Lindgren, Robert Hines, Jessica Watkins - are from NASA, the fourth - Samantha Cristoforetti is from European Space Agency. NASA said it was one of the fastest flights to the ISS.

194.title: Petrol will be cheaper if states cut taxes on fuel instead of liquor: Petroleum Minister
194.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday tweeted, "Petrol will be cheaper if opposition ruled states cut taxes on fuel instead of imported liquor!" He added, "Maharashtra govt imposes ₹32.15/ltr on petrol & Congress ruled Rajasthan ₹29.10. But BJP ruled Uttarakhand levies only ₹14.51 & Uttar Pradesh ₹16.50." He further wrote, "Protests cannot challenge facts!"

195.title: Gavaskar punched the ceiling, jumped and screamed: Pietersen on Umran taking 5 wickets
195.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen said the way ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar celebrated in the commentary box after SRH pacer Umran Malik's five-wicket haul was "more exciting" than the dismissals. Pietersen added that Gavaskar punched the ceiling, jumped and screamed. "I think he did that because how often have we seen India producing the fastest bowler in world cricket?" Pietersen stated.

196.title: North stars are jealous of south stars after KGF 2's success: Ram Gopal Varma
196.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn recently took offence to Kiccha Sudeep's "Hindi is not our national language" comment. Reacting to it, filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took Sudeep's side and wrote, "The base undeniable ground truth @KicchaSudeep sir, is that the north stars are insecure and jealous of the south stars because a Kannada dubbing film #KGF2 had a ₹50 crore opening day."

197.title: Got attention in childhood; people clapped & whistled, I got addicted: Yash
197.article_body: Actor Yash said that he used to participate in a lot of cultural activities in his childhood. "I used to get that extra attention...people used to clap and whistle. So I think I got addicted to it at a very young age," he added. Yash further said that he always wanted to be a hero and never had plan B.

198.title: I didn't like how villains treated my mom in films: Mandakini's son Rabbil
198.article_body: 'Ram Teri Ganga Maili' actress Mandakini's son Rabbil Thakur said he did not watch any of his mother's films during his childhood, as he did not like watching them. "I used to not like seeing the way villains treated my mom. I [did not]...understand the concept that this is just a movie and she is just acting," added Rabbil.

199.title: SRK throwing T-shirts not act of negligence: HC on 2017 stampede incident
199.article_body: Gujarat High Court has quashed a criminal complaint against Shah Rukh Khan, observing that the actor throwing T-shirts and smiley balls at Vadodara railway station in 2017 while promoting 'Raees' cannot be termed acts of "high degree of negligence". According to the complaint, Khan threw the items at the crowd, which resulted in a stampede and death of a person.

200.title: Pic of Rahul Dravid throwing cap in anger resurfaces after Muralitharan's outburst
200.article_body: After Muttiah Muralitharan got angry and shouted in frustration during SRH's defeat against GT, fans recalled Rahul Dravid throwing his cap in anger during IPL 2014. Dravid, who was RR's mentor at the time, threw the cap after their defeat against MI. "Only tournament in the world that can make Dravid and Muralitharan lose their calm," a fan tweeted.

201.title: US govt's religious freedom body criticises India; Hindu council calls it 'Indophobic'
201.article_body: After US Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF) recommended to the US administration to designate India and 14 other nations as "country of particular concern" in the context of status of religious freedom, HinduPACT said USCIRF has been taken over by "Indophobic and Hinduphobic members". "Many of these members have attended India and Hindu bashing events," HinduPACT added.

202.title: Maha man asked to shut up after fight with wife slaps constable, held
202.article_body: Kongaon Police arrested a man for slapping constable following fight with his wife. The accused tried to break the main door after thumping on it, after which, his wife got scared. "Our constables...brought...man to the police station...he started abusing police officials...when he was asked to shut up...he slapped...a constable and pushed others who tried to stop him," an officer said.

203.title: Truck speeds away for kilometres with toll official standing on bumper in Andhra
203.article_body: A video went viral showing a truck speeding away on a highway in Andhra Pradesh with a toll official standing on its bumper. As per reports, the driver was asked to pay a fine after which he sped away. The worker was reportedly scanning FASTag by standing on the bumper. The truck was reportedly stopped by police after several kilometres.

204.title: India reports 3,303 COVID-19 cases, 39 deaths in 24 hours
204.article_body: India has reported 3,303 COVID-19 cases, 2,563 recoveries and 39 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,927 COVID-19 cases and 32 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 16,980, while the death toll rose to 5,23,693.

205.title: US judge rejects Musk's bid to end Tesla tweets review under SEC deal
205.article_body: A US judge has rejected Tesla CEO Elon Musk's bid to end the condition to have his tweets on Tesla vetted by a competent lawyer before posting, a requirement under his US SEC deal. Musk has claimed he was forced to agree to the deal. The judge said Musk's free speech argument against the deal is "meritless" and "particularly ironic".

206.title: 2 youths arrested for stealing silencers of 14 cars in Pune
206.article_body: Two youths have been arrested for stealing silencers of 14 cars and selling their parts in Pune. According to police, the duo "would extract catalytic converter from these cars and extract the crushed material that has components of expensive elements". "We are yet to nab the person to whom they sold these elements," Loni Kalbhor Police Station officials said.

207.title: Need control over Delhi as it is the face of India: Centre to SC
207.article_body: Centre told the Supreme Court that it needs to have control over administrative services in Delhi as the world views India through its national capital. "It's necessary...Centre has powers over appointments and transfers of public servants. Delhi is the face of the nation," it added. SC was hearing petitions by the Delhi government against the Centre's control of civil services.

208.title: Fire breaks out at Chennai’s Rajiv Gandhi hospital, no casualties reported
208.article_body: A massive fire broke out at Chennai's Rajiv Gandhi government hospital around 11 am on Wednesday. "This was an unexpected accident which happened due to...short circuit," Health Minister Ma Subramanian said after visiting the spot. No injuries or casualties have been reported. Earlier, four fire tenders were rushed to the spot and more joined later to douse the fire.

209.title: India not part of climate problem but will play big role in solution: Union Minister
209.article_body: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on Wednesday said India is not a part of the climate problem but it wants to be and will be a big part of the solution. "To address climate change, technology transfer is necessary…India is among few G20 countries that have fulfilled its nationally determined contribution (NDC) under the Paris Agreement," Yadav stated.

210.title: Don't think Hardik Pandya will bowl a lot now in IPL 2022: Wasim Jaffer
210.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said GT captain Hardik Pandya, who hasn't bowled in his last two games, is unlikely to "bowl a lot" in their upcoming matches as the team has got all their bases covered. "GT will take care of Hardik and [he'll] only bowl if needed to...they've Lockie [Ferguson], [Mohammad] Shami, and Alzarri Joseph," explained Jaffer.

211.title: J&K Army-run school asks staff to avoid hijab; official clarifies
211.article_body: An Indian Army-run school in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla asked its staff to avoid wearing hijab during school hours. This triggered a controversy with several political leaders opposing the move. Following this, Defence spokesperson Emron Musavi clarified that the circular mistakenly mentioned hijab instead of 'niqab' [a veil which covers the entire face except for eyes].

212.title: Central Railway allows co-branding rights to stations in Mumbai division
212.article_body: The Central Railway has allowed private companies, corporates, banks and government agencies to brand their names in 83 stations, which includes almost all stations of Mumbai division to generate non-fare income. "We are in the bidding process right now. We have received interest from private companies for a few railway stations of Palghar and Dahanu," a Western Railway official said.

213.title: I'd love to work with Aishwarya, I enjoy working with her: Abhishek on wife
213.article_body: When asked if he would like to work with his wife, actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, anytime soon, actor Abhishek Bachchan said, "I'd love to collaborate with her again, but obviously, it has to be the right script at the right time." Speaking about his wife as an actor, Abhishek said that she is wonderful and he enjoys working with her.

214.title: Delhi Police busts fake arms licence racket, 4 people arrested
214.article_body: The Crime Branch of Delhi Police has busted a fake arms licence racket and arrested four persons. Based on a tip-off, police laid a trap and apprehended one person accused of carrying illegal arms. On further investigation, the other three accused were also arrested. About 15 fake arms licences, purportedly issued from Jammu and Kashmir, were recovered from the accused.

215.title: He has been bowling beautifully: Williamson on Umran's 5/25 vs GT
215.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson praised pacer Umran Malik for his performance against GT, stating that the 22-year-old is bowling beautifully in the tournament. "It was an outstanding performance [against GT]," he added. Umran picked a five-wicket haul in the game, conceding 25 runs. SRH lost the match after Rashid Khan smashed three sixes off Marco Jansen in the final over.

216.title: Karnataka reports 126 new COVID-19 cases; 114 in Bengaluru alone
216.article_body: Karnataka on Wednesday reported 126 new COVID-19 cases out of which 114 were reported in Bengaluru alone. The city also recorded 92 daily coronavirus recoveries and a positivity rate of 3.06%, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). Notably, with the new cases, the total number of active coronavirus cases in Bengaluru has risen to 1,648.

217.title: Guj teacher arrested for derogatory WhatsApp post against minority
217.article_body: A school teacher was arrested in Gujarat's Ahmedabad for allegedly sharing a derogatory post against a minority community on WhatsApp. The police said the accused, Manisha Bhavsar, "was part of several WhatsApp groups where she had shared and saved posts that were derogatory against the Muslim community". "After technical surveillance and investigation, the accused was arrested," added police.

218.title: Hyderabad Police busts organised gambling racket, 7 held
218.article_body: Hyderabad's Banjara Hills Police busted an organised gambling racket in Yousufguda's Sri Krishna Nagar area. Acting on credible information, police conducted a raid and arrested seven accused persons, including the (gambling) organiser. The organiser used to invite punters, who have the habit of gambling by betting money and gaining easy money illegally, Banjara Hills SHO said.

219.title: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak cleared of ethics breach over wife's non-dom status
219.article_body: UK Chancellor Rishi Sunak has been cleared by PM Boris Johnson's ethics adviser of breaching ministerial rules over his wife Akshata Murty's non-dom status and the green card granting him residency in the US. The independent adviser Christopher Geidt said Sunak had declared his interests correctly and had been "assiduous in meeting his obligations and in engaging with this investigation".

220.title: Ex-Twitter CEO tells Musk 'bullying isn't leadership', he reacts
220.article_body: Former Twitter CEO Dick Costolo reacted to Elon Musk's response to Twitter's General Counsel Vijaya Gadde reportedly crying over his takeover and expressing concerns, saying, "Bullying is not leadership...You're making an executive at the company you just bought...target of harassment." In response, Musk said, "What are talking about? I'm just saying Twitter needs to be politically neutral."

221.title: India built ties with Russia out of necessity as we couldn't do it earlier: US
221.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has said, "Russia, for India, was out of necessity a partner of choice when we were not in a position to be a partner." "Now, we are investing in that effort. I think there is a growing strategic convergence between the United States and India," Blinken further said.

222.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read after 40 matches?
222.article_body: Following the conclusion of 40 matches in IPL 2022, GT are on top of the points table with 14 points. RR are second on the points table with 12 points. They are followed by SRH, LSG and RCB, who have 10 points each. MI, who are yet to win a match in the tournament, are placed last on the table.

223.title: Muralitharan shouts in anger during last over of SRH-GT match, video goes viral
223.article_body: SRH's strategy and spin bowling coach Muttiah Muralitharan was seen shouting in anger when GT vice-captain Rashid Khan smashed SRH pacer Marco Jansen for a six in last over of their IPL 2022 match. Muralitharan stood up from his chair and purportedly said, "Why the f**k is he bowling full?" Jansen conceded 25 runs in the over as GT won.

224.title: Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in: Elon Musk
224.article_body: Days after he struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion, Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Next I'm buying Coca-Cola to put the cocaine back in." Reacting to his tweet, a user wrote, "Can you buy the moon for me Elon? Earth has lots of wars going on," while another tweeted, "Buy TikTok and delete it."

225.title: Farmers send mango stock to Pune due to rains, prices slashed by 25%
225.article_body: Farmers from Konkan belt have started sending mango stock to Pune Market Yard due to unexpected rains. In last week, over 10,000 boxes of Alphonso mangoes have arrived in Market Yard. Due to increase in supply, prices of these mangoes have been reduced by at least  25%. Sale of mangoes is also increasing as Akshaya Tritiya is approaching.

226.title: 2 men die after falling into sewer pit in Delhi's Bawana
226.article_body: At least two men died after falling into a sewer pit in Delhi's Bawana area on Wednesday, officials said. The men were working near the spot when the accident took place, officials added. "The firemen pulled out the men...sent them to the Maharishi Valmiki Hospital where the doctors declared them brought dead," Delhi Fire Services (DFS) chief Atul Garg said.

227.title: SRH's Umran Malik records best bowling figures of IPL 2022
227.article_body: SRH fast bowler Umran Malik on Wednesday recorded the best bowling figures of IPL 2022. The 22-year-old pacer recorded figures of 4-0-25-5 against GT, registering his first-ever five-wicket haul in T20 cricket. The previous best bowling figures of IPL 2022 (4-0-40-5) were recorded by RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal against KKR on April 18.

228.title: 2-year-old boy dies after being attacked by stray dogs in Hyderabad
228.article_body: A two-year-old boy died after being attacked by a pack of stray dogs in Hyderabad, reports stated. The boy was playing near his house when the dogs attacked and dragged him to adjoining military area on Tuesday night. Meanwhile, locals have alleged that Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) failed to act though stray dogs pose a grave threat to them.

229.title: GT smash 4 sixes in last over to beat SRH on last ball, reclaim top spot on points table
229.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) defeated SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) by five wickets to reclaim the top spot on the IPL 2022 points table. GT chased down the target of 196 on their last delivery. Needing 22 runs in the last over, GT smashed four sixes and scored 25 runs to complete the chase. Rashid Khan slammed an unbeaten 31 off 11 deliveries.

230.title: COVID-19 situation in Karnataka is under control: CM Bommai
230.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said the COVID-19 situation in the state is under control. He added that 2% of international passengers will be randomly tested and teletracking of passengers coming from Australia, Indonesia, New Zealand and South Korea will be carried out. Samples of hospitalised patients who are COVID-19 positive will be sent for genome sequencing, he added.

231.title: Imran Khan begged Pakistani army till last minute to save his govt: Maryam Nawaz
231.article_body: Pakistan's ousted Prime Minister Imran Khan was so desperate that he "begged" the military establishment till the last minute to save his government, Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) Vice President Maryam Nawaz has claimed. "He had even requested former President and PPP co-chairman Asif Ali Zardari to help him in the wake of a no-confidence motion against him," Maryam said.

232.title: James Murdoch's Bodhi Tree partners with Reliance to invest ₹13,500 cr in Viacom18
232.article_body: Reliance and Viacom18 have inked a partnership with Bodhi Tree to turn Viacom18 into "one of the largest TV and digital streaming companies" in India. Bodhi Tree is a platform run by James Murdoch's Lupa Systems and ex-Disney executive Uday Shankar. Reliance's JioCinema will also be transferred to Viacom18 as part of the Bodhi Tree-led ₹13,500-crore investment deal.

233.title: India in talks with Norway wealth fund, GIC over LIC IPO: Report
233.article_body: India is in talks to sign up Norway's sovereign wealth fund and Singapore's GIC Pte as anchor investors for LIC IPO, Bloomberg reported. As per its sources, Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, BlackRock Inc and Fidelity have been approached as well. The Centre is looking to finalise the anchor investor list within days, the report added.

234.title: He removed his bag to accommodate Viv's bag: Vivek Razdan on Kohli's gesture on flight
234.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Vivek Razdan recalled how Virat Kohli once removed his own bag from the overhead locker of a flight in the Caribbean to accommodate the bag of ex-West Indies captain Viv Richards, who was unable to find space. "Kohli...kept his bag below the seat ahead of him," Razdan added. "Richards tapped his shoulder and thanked him," he further said.

235.title: IAS officer booked after IRS officer wife's dowry harassment allegation in MP
235.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh police have filed a case against an Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer after his wife accused him and his family members of dowry harassment. Police said that the woman is an Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officer. “Based on the complaint, a case was registered against the IAS officer, his mother and sister for dowry harassment,” police said.

236.title: 'Major' to release on June 3, will clash with Akshay's 'Prithviraj'
236.article_body: Adivi Sesh-starrer 'Major' has been postponed again and now will release on June 3. Previously, the film was slated to release on May 27. However, the actor announced on Twitter that the release has been pushed by a week. The film's release date had earlier been postponed due to the pandemic. The film will now clash with Akshay Kumar's 'Prithviraj'.

237.title: Your rules won't apply here: EU to Musk over Twitter deal
237.article_body: The European Union has warned that Elon Musk-owned Twitter will have to respect the bloc's rules regarding online content moderation. "Elon, there are rules...It's not your rules which will apply here," said EU Internal Market Chief Thierry Breton. He added that if Twitter fails to comply, the EU could fine 6% of its annual revenue or even ban it entirely.

238.title: Bomb threat letter found at railway station in Punjab's Kapurthala
238.article_body: A bomb threat letter was found at Sultanpur Lodhi Railway Station in Punjab's Kapurthala on Wednesday, ANI reported. The letter mentioned that major railway stations like Sultanpur Lodhi, Ferozepur and Jalandhar will be blown up by May 21 to avenge, ANI quoted the Station Master as saying. It also reportedly mentioned that Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann will also be attacked.

239.title: ₹1 lakh ex-gratia to those severely injured in Thanjavur incident
239.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin met those who were injured in the Thanjavur electrocution incident and announced ex-gratia of ₹1 lakh to those severely injured and ₹50,000 to the injured. "It is a tragic and painful incident. We have ordered officials to take action on this issue," he said. Eleven people were killed and 15 were injured in the incident.

240.title: I wish Musk the very best, our social media rules remain unchanged: MoS IT
240.article_body: Rajeev Chandrasekhar, the Union Minister of State (MoS) for Electronics and Information Technology, told ET, "I wish Elon Musk the very best," as the world's richest person struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion. He added that the government's goals and expectations of accountability and safety rules for all social media intermediaries, including Twitter, remain the same.

241.title: Man Utd's Rangnick accepts top-four finish in PL is not 'realistic'
241.article_body: Manchester United's interim manager Ralf Rangnick accepts that a top-four finish in the Premier League this season is not "realistic" ahead of their Premier League clash with Chelsea on Thursday. United are currently sixth on the table with 54 points with four games left. "Even if we win all four games, it's still not in our own hands," Rangnick said.

242.title: Australian minister accuses China of interference ahead of federal polls
242.article_body: Australian minister Karen Andrews on Wednesday suggested that China deliberately announced its security pact with Solomon Islands ahead of Australian federal polls in a bid to derail Liberal Party's re-election. She further claimed that China wants the Labor Party to win elections. Notably, Labor Party has claimed that Australian government's inability to stall pact is a foreign policy failure.

243.title: India has one language, which is entertainment: Sonu Sood on national language debate
243.article_body: Sonu Sood spoke about the ongoing debate on whether Hindi can be considered the national language of the country. "I don't think Hindi can be called just the national language. India has one language, which is entertainment," he said. "It doesn't really matter which industry you belong to. If you entertain people, they will love you...and accept you," Sonu added.

244.title: Danish teenager Rune beats world no. 3 Zverev in Munich
244.article_body: Danish teenager Holger Rune on Wednesday beat world number three Alexander Zverev 6-3, 6-2 at the ATP 250 tournament in Munich. "I have a lot of respect for him, and I obviously didn't expect to win in two sets, and with a score like this," the 18-year-old said. Rune's victory over Zverev is his first against a Top 10 opponent.

245.title: Opp'n hasn't reduced VAT on fuel, BJP did months before: Minister
245.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said that the Opposition ruled states have not reduced taxes on fuel, despite BJP-led states having done it months before. "Opposition only looks at the Centre but does not reduce the taxes in their own states. Don't they want to benefit the people who voted them to power?" he said.

246.title: Indonesia widens export ban to include crude and refined palm oil
246.article_body: Indonesia has widened the scope of its export ban on raw materials for cooking oil to include crude and refined palm oil, Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said on Wednesday. In a separate statement, President Joko Widodo said people's need for affordable food trumped revenue concerns. Export ban will be lifted once domestic needs are met, Widodo said.

247.title: Reliance, Apollo Global plan joint bid for UK pharma chain Boots: Report
247.article_body: Reliance Industries and US-based Apollo Global Management are planning a joint bid for UK's high street pharmacy chain Boots, the Financial Times reported. Both would own equity stakes in Boots under the plan, however, it's unclear whether the size of their stakes would be the same. Boots' US parent Walgreens Boots Alliance put the business for sale in December 2021.

248.title: Web space gave me visibility like never before: Sikandar Kher
248.article_body: Actor Sikandar Kher has said the OTT platform gave him visibility that he never got before. "As an actor, you need and want people to see your work and your abilities," he stated. "When you get that many eyeballs, filmmakers also get the chance to view you in their projects and the characters they create," Sikandar further added.

249.title: We need to take more chances: Foden on CL SF clash with Real Madrid
249.article_body: Phil Foden admitted Manchester City needed to "take more chances" after their Champions League semi-final first-leg clash on Tuesday. City won 4-3 despite having a two-goal advantage on three occasions. "It was a great game. End to end. We started really well and could have killed them off. In these games, we need to take more chances," Foden said.

250.title: World no.1 Swiatek withdraws from Madrid Open with shoulder injury
250.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek has withdrawn from the Madrid Open due to a right shoulder injury. "I need a break from playing so intensively in order to treat my arm well and that's why, unfortunately, I have to withdraw," the 20-year-old said. Swiatek is on a 23-match unbeaten streak after winning her fourth consecutive title in Stuttgart on Sunday.

251.title: Finnish, Swedish security services warn of Russian interference amid NATO bid
251.article_body: Finland and Sweden must be vigilant of Russian spy operations and cyber attacks as they consider NATO membership bid, nordic countries' intelligence chiefs said on Wednesday. The announcement comes amid reports that the countries may apply to join alliance in May. Russia has warned of deploying nuclear weapons and hypersonic missiles in Baltic enclave of Kaliningrad if they join NATO.

252.title: No longer good enough to supply defensive weapons to Ukraine: Truss
252.article_body: Foreign Secretary Liz Truss on Tuesday said it is no longer good enough for Britain to supply only defensive weapons to Ukraine against its war with Russia. "For too long, there was a false distinction between defensive and offensive weapons. It became an excuse for some to drag their feet. That time has now passed," she said.

253.title: EU tiggers rule of law mechanism against Hungarian government
253.article_body: The EU on Wednesday launched its rule of law mechanism against the Hungarian government that could strip Hungary of its EU funding. The mechanism allows the EU to withhold funds from member states if they are found to have committed violations against the EU's democratic standards. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen criticised "corruption" in Hungary earlier this month.

254.title: Won't do too many dance numbers, it's a matter of being typecast: Regina
254.article_body: Actress Regina Cassandra, who has a dance number in 'Acharya', said she would not do too many of them in the future. "A few years ago, I was offered a song with Chiranjeevi. After that, I got many more offers to do item numbers," she stated. "Makers felt...why can't I do it in another? It's...matter of being typecast," Regina added.

255.title: Paying for Russian gas in roubles breaches sanctions: EU chief
255.article_body: European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday said paying for Russian gas in roubles would breach sanctions imposed on Russia. "We have about 97% of all contracts that explicitly stipulate payments in euros or dollars," she said. Unless a supply contract was denominated in roubles, European firms should not accede to Russia's demands, she added.

256.title: 1 dead, 24 missing after migrant boat capsizes off Canary Islands
256.article_body: Authorities said a boat carrying 61 migrants capsized off Spain's Canary Islands leaving one person dead and 24 missing. Spain's marine services rescued 36 people, including two minors and 10 women, and recovered the body of a woman. A spokeswoman said three boats in total were intercepted. A total of 116 people were rescued from the other two boats.

257.title: 36th Russian colonel killed in Ukraine since invasion began
257.article_body: Lieutenant Colonel Oleg Yevseev is the 36th Russian colonel to be killed in Ukraine since Russia's invasion began on February 24. Russia did not provide details on how or when he died. Yevseev was a commander of the 291st Artillery Brigade of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation. At least 36 colonels and eight generals have died so far.

258.title: COVID-19 is now at an endemic stage, not pandemic: Mexican govt
258.article_body: The Mexican government said COVID-19 is no longer a pandemic but has passed to an endemic stage in Mexico. "It is now retreating almost completely," President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said. Mexico has recorded almost 325,000 COVID-19 related deaths since the pandemic began, although government reviews of death certificates suggest the actual death toll could be about 490,000.

259.title: GT's Lockie Ferguson bowls most expensive 20th over in IPL 2022
259.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) fast bowler Lockie Ferguson on Wednesday bowled the most expensive 20th over in an IPL 2022 match after conceding 25 runs against SRH. Ferguson was hit for four sixes in the over, out of which three were hit by Shashank Singh. Ferguson recorded bowling figures of 4-0-52-0 in the match.

260.title: 14-yr-old gets pregnant after being raped by 5 Russian soldiers, plans to keep the baby
260.article_body: A 14-year-old girl is pregnant after being raped by five Russian soldiers in Ukraine, said reports. The teenager, from Bucha, plans to keep the child after doctors warned if she had an abortion now she may not be able to have children again. Her story has been shared by psychologist Oleksandra Kvitko, who is helping her accept the child.

261.title: Ukraine still in control of majority of its airspace: UK
261.article_body: Britain's Ministry of Defence on Wednesday said Ukraine remains in control of the majority of its airspace as Russia has failed to "effectively destroy" Ukraine's air force. They said Ukraine's air defences have also not been "suppressed" by Russian forces which first invaded Ukraine on February 24. "Ukraine continues to hold Russian air assets at risk," they added.

262.title: Will take considerate view on crypto, it can't be rushed: FM
262.article_body: The government will take a considerate decision on cryptocurrency regulation but it can't be rushed through, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. However, she added that the government is open to promote innovation made in the distributed ledger technologies. "Our intention is in no way to hurt this (innovation around crypto)...but (we need to) define for ourselves," she stated.

263.title: Rashid Khan records his 3rd most expensive spell in IPL
263.article_body: GT leg-spinner Rashid Khan on Wednesday recorded his third-most expensive spell in IPL. The 23-year-old gave away 45 runs against SRH, registering figures of 4-0-45-0. Rashid was hit for three sixes and two fours in his spell. Rashid's most expensive spell in IPL had come on April 19, 2018, when he conceded 55 runs against PBKS while representing SRH.

264.title: US considers imposing sanctions against Putin's alleged girlfriend: Reports
264.article_body: The US is reportedly considering imposing sanctions against Alina Kabaeva, the woman it believes is Russian President Vladimir Putin's girlfriend and mother of at least three of his children. The WSJ claimed that earlier, the US spared Kabaeva from Russian sanctions in a "last-minute" decision. Russia's 38-year-old politician Kabaeva is a retired Olympic gold medal winner in rhythmic gymnastics.

265.title: Travis Scott to publicly perform for 1st time since Astroworld tragedy
265.article_body: Travis Scott will be performing publicly for the first time since the Astroworld tragedy that took place in November last year and killed 10 people. The rapper will be performing in Miami on May 7 at E11even during the 'Race Week' ahead of the F1 Grand Prix race. E11even's website has begun the sale for the tickets for Scott's event.

266.title: 26-yr-old woman beats 3-yr-old son to death in Raj, arrested
266.article_body: A 26-year-old woman was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly beating her three-and-a-half-year-old son to death in Chhipabarod town of Baran district, police said. The woman beat her son at their house bolting the room from inside, Chhipabarod Police Station SHO Ravinder Singh said. The accused was arrested after her husband, Anil Jatav, filed a police report against her.

267.title: McLaren's Ricciardo apologises to Ferrari's Sainz after 1st lap crash
267.article_body: McLaren's Daniel Ricciardo apologised to Ferrari's Carlos Sainz after causing a collision in the first lap of the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix last Sunday. Ricciardo finished the race in 18th place. "Obviously not the way I wanted Sunday to go. A painful one and obviously not the way I want to affect somebody else's race," Ricciardo said.

268.title: Destroyed 'large batch' of Western-supplied arms in Ukraine: Russia
268.article_body: Russian forces have destroyed a large quantity of foreign weapons in southeastern Ukraine with long-range missiles, the country's defence ministry said on Wednesday. According to the ministry, the destroyed weapons were supplied by the US and European countries for Ukrainian troops. This comes after the US and 40 other nations held a security summit to discuss arms supplies to Ukraine.

269.title: Russia bans 287 UK lawmakers from entering country amid Ukraine war
269.article_body: Russia on Wednesday placed sanctions on 287 lawmakers from the UK's lower house of parliament and banned them from entering the country amid the ongoing Ukraine invasion. "These persons...contribute(d) to the groundless whipping up of Russophobic hysteria in the UK," a statement from Russia's foreign ministry read. Russia's move came after the UK imposed sanctions on 386 Russian parliamentarians.

270.title: NDMA issues guidelines for COVID-19 death compensation
270.article_body: The National Disaster Management Authority on Wednesday issued guidelines for those wanting compensation for the death of a family member due to COVID-19. The guideline said that those wanting compensation will have to file the application by May 23 and all COVID-19 deaths that have occurred before March 20, 2022, are eligible to apply for compensation.

271.title: Labour Ministry calls Infosys for discussion on non-compete clause
271.article_body: The Labour Ministry issued a notice to Infosys to hold a joint discussion on April 28 regarding the enforcement of the non-compete agreement. The agreement bans ex-employees from working for same customers in rival firms for six months. This comes after Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES), an IT union, filed a complaint with the Ministry seeking the clause's removal.

272.title: I'm able to make choices in films because of my family's work: Harsh
272.article_body: Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor, speaking about his films' choices, has said, "The reason I can make the choices that I've done is because of the work...they (his family) have done." "I'm secure...Financially, emotionally...I'm able to make those choices. So, thanks to the work that the family has done for so many decades," he further added. Harsh will feature in 'Thar'.

273.title: BJP and CPI(M) are trying to defame West Bengal: Mamata Banerjee
273.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that the law and order situation in West Bengal was under control and accused some sections of media of spreading misinformation. "A suicide case was turned into a rape case. BJP and CPI(M) are both trying to defame Bengal," Mamata Banerjee said. We will not let Bengal become Hathras or Unnao, she added.

274.title: Shooting of 'Scam 2003' begins, Hansal Mehta shares pic from the sets
274.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta took to Instagram and said the shooting of 'Scam 2003' has begun. Hansal shared an image of the clapboard and wrote, "And we rolled today." 'Scam 2003' will be directed by Tushar Hiranandani. Hansal had directed 'Scam 1992: The Harshad Mehta Story'. The series will be tentatively named 'Scam 2003: The Curious Case of Abdul Karim Telgi'.

275.title: 6,000 loudspeakers removed, volume of 30,000 speakers lowered in UP
275.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Police said that over 6,000 unauthorised loudspeakers were removed from religious places across the state. The volume of other 30,000 loudspeakers was set to permissible limits following a government order, the police added. Prashant Kumar, ADGP (Law and Order), said, "Orders of the High Court regarding loudspeakers are also being considered during the exercise."

276.title: Kejriwal stretches during meet with PM Modi, video goes viral
276.article_body: A video of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal stretching and sitting in a relaxed manner with his hands behind his head during PM Narendra Modi's meet with Chief Ministers on COVID-19 situation has gone viral. Sharing the video, BJP criticised Kejriwal and called him "mannerless". "Arvind Kejriwal continues to disgrace himself with uncouth mannerism," tweeted BJP's Amit Malviya.

277.title: BJP-led NDA govt has failed, is a 'non-performing asset': KTR
277.article_body: TRS Working President KT Rama Rao on Wednesday said the BJP-led NDA government has failed on all fronts and has become a "non-performing asset". Even though the NDA government talked about "Aatmanirbhar Bharat" (self-reliant India), there has been no improvement in the living standards of the people, Rao said. TRS should play a key role in national politics, he added.

278.title: Without Gandhi family, there would be no Congress: AK Antony
278.article_body: Senior Congress leader AK Antony on Wednesday stated that the Nehru-Gandhi family is the powerhouse of Congress, without whom, the party wouldn't exist. "Without Congress' role, you cannot think of...change of guard in Delhi," Antony added. His remarks come a day after poll strategist Prashant Kishor declined to join the party, citing a need for leadership overhaul in Congress.

279.title: Electricity deliberately curtailed during sehri & iftar: Ex J&K CM
279.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Wednesday said electricity is deliberately being curtailed at sehri and iftar hours to hassle the Muslim population observing the holy month of Ramadan. He also weighed in on the loudspeaker row and said, "Why can't loudspeakers be allowed at mosques when they're being used in other places?"

280.title: PM wants startup founders to come from tier 2, 3 cities: MoS IT
280.article_body: PM Modi wants the next wave of startup founders to come from tier 2 and tier 3 cities, Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said. He stated, "It's a 100% policy objective [that] digital opportunities are equally available...in Ghaziabad, Jharkhand, Srinagar, Kohima...as much...in Bengaluru." Once 5G gets rolled out, youngsters will "itch" to get into technology sector, he added.

281.title: Constitute a grievance board: Delhi HC to AIIMS over nurses' strike
281.article_body: After All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) nurses called off their strike last night, the Delhi High Court has asked AIIMS to constitute a board for hearing grievances of the employees. "Do not take immediate action. Let things cool down. Take undertaking, set up a board," Justice Yashwant Varma directed AIIMS. You have to strike a balance, he added.

282.title: Apple opens Self Service Repair to iPhone users in US
282.article_body: Apple on Wednesday announced the launch of Self Service Repair in the US. As part of the facility, owners of iPhone 12, 13 and third-generation SE can go through repair manuals, and then buy the parts required to fix common issues with the handsets online. The service will be expanded to additional countries, starting with Europe, later this year.

283.title: Obama loses, Bolsonaro gains followers as Musk buys Twitter: Report
283.article_body: Barack Obama lost 3,00,000 followers while Katy Perry and Taylor Swift lost 2,00,000 and 1,00,000 followers respectively after Elon Musk bought Twitter on Monday, NBC reported. Meanwhile, right-wing politicians including Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro and US Representative Marjorie Greene gained several followers. Responding to the report, Twitter said the "fluctuations" were "organic".

284.title: State govt can't be blamed: Maha CM on PM's remark on high fuel prices
284.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday said the state government can't be held responsible for rising fuel prices. He said Maharashtra gets only 5.5% of central taxes even though it contributes 38.3% to direct taxes and 15% to India's GST revenue. This comes after PM Narendra Modi requested several states, including Maharashtra, to cut VAT on petrol and diesel.

285.title: Xiaomi launches Xiaomi 12 Pro 5G in India at starting price of ₹62,999
285.article_body: Xiaomi has launched the Xiaomi 12 Pro 5G in India at a starting price of ₹62,999. The smartphone is equipped with Snapdragon® 8 Gen 1, a 50MP triple rear camera and 4,600 mAh battery that supports 120W fast charging, and comes in the colours Couture Blue, Noir Black and Olive Mauve. The sale will go live on May 2.

286.title: Kirit Somaiya received minor injuries when attacked by Sena workers: Police
286.article_body: Mumbai police said that BJP's Kirit Somaiya received minor injuries after he was attacked by Shiv Sena workers. They added, "Bhabha Hospital in Bandra which treated Kirit Somaiya following the attack stated, 'It was not a major injury. There was minimal bleeding'." Somaiya was attacked when he went to meet MP Navneet Rana and her husband at Khar police station.

287.title: Hindustan Unilever's profit rises 8.6% YoY to ₹2,327 crore in Q4
287.article_body: Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) on Wednesday reported an 8.6% rise in its profit after tax from ₹2,143 crore in Q4 FY21 to ₹2,327 crore in Q4 FY22. Its profit in FY22 rose 10.9% YoY to ₹8,818 crore. The company said its revenue from sale of products  in Q4 FY22 came in at ₹13,190 crore, up 10.40% YoY from ₹11,947 crore.

288.title: Delhi reports 1,367 new COVID-19 cases, 14% higher than yesterday
288.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday reported 1,367 new COVID-19 cases, 14% more than 1,204 fresh cases reported a day ago. As many as 1,042 recoveries and one death from COVID-19 were reported in the last 24 hours. The positivity rate slightly dipped to 4.5% on Wednesday from 4.64% a day ago, according to the Delhi government's daily COVID-19 bulletin.

289.title: WB spent ₹1,500 cr to subsidise fuel prices: CM after fuel price meet
289.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday criticised PM Narendra Modi who urged states to reduce VAT and said that her government has spent ₹1,500 crore in the last three years to subsidise fuel prices. "Today's interaction with PM Modi was completely one-sided and misleading. The facts shared by him were wrong," she said

290.title: Mamata will be real game-changer in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: Sinha
290.article_body: Newly-elected Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Shatrughan Sinha praised party supremo Mamata Banerjee and claimed that she could be "real game-changer" in 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Sinha, who won from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency in bypoll, stated that Banerjee is "tried and tested leader who's respected by all". He added that he had left BJP as party turned into an autocracy.

291.title: Kiccha Sudeep responds after Devgn tweets 'Hindi will always be our national language'
291.article_body: Kannada actor Kiccha Sudeep responded after Ajay Devgn tweeted that Hindi will "always be our national language" following Sudeep's remark that Hindi is "no more" a national language. "The context to why I said that...is...different," he said, adding he "respects every language". "No offense sir...but was wondering what'd the situation be if my response was typed in Kannada!!" he stated.

292.title: Temperatures rising earlier than usual in country, fire cases rising: PM warns CMs
292.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while interacting with CMs of various states on the COVID-19 situation, said that he'd like to discuss "one more topic". "Temperatures in the country are rising rapidly...and these temperatures are rising earlier than usual...the incidents of fire are increasing," the PM warned. "I request all states to conduct safety audits of hospitals on priority," the PM added.

293.title: Bilawal Bhutto Zardari takes oath as Pak's youngest foreign minister
293.article_body: Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) chairman Bilawal Bhutto Zardari took oath as 37th Foreign Minister of Pakistan on Wednesday. Bilawal, 33, who was administered oath by President Arif Alvi at Aiwan-i-Sadr (President's House), is reportedly the country's youngest foreign minister. Bilawal was first elected to National Assembly in 2018 but this is the first time he's been inducted into federal cabinet.

294.title: Proud to be sanctioned: UK lawmaker as Russia bars entry to 287 UK MPs
294.article_body: After Russia imposed personal restrictions on 287 UK MPs and banned them from entering the country, senior UK lawmaker Mark Harper said he's proud to be on the list. "Russia really hates being called out for their illegal invasion of Ukraine and disgraceful war crimes," Harper tweeted. Notably, Russia has accused the 287 sanctioned-UK MPs of fuelling "unwarranted Russophobic hysteria".

295.title: Machine Gun Kelly & I consume each other's blood during rituals: Megan
295.article_body: Actress Megan Fox said she and her fiance Machine Gun Kelly consume each other's blood during rituals. "It's just a few drops, but...we do consume each other's blood on occasion for ritual purposes only," Megan stated. "Kelly's much more haphazard...hectic and chaotic, where he's willing to...cut his chest open with broken glass and be like, 'Take my soul'," she added.

296.title: GT to bowl first after SRH lose toss for 1st time in IPL 2022, Washington returns
296.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bowl first against SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) in their IPL 2022 match on Wednesday. It is the first time that SRH have lost a toss in IPL 2022. SRH have made one change to their playing XI, with Washington Sundar returning after recovering from an injury.

297.title: Kamal Haasan pays his condolences to the families of Thanjavur victims
297.article_body: Kamal Haasan paid his condolences to the families of the victims after 11 people died due to electrocution in Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu after a temple chariot came in contact with an electric wire. "District administration...police...local administration should...take...precautionary measures with the festival organizers at such gatherings," Kamal tweeted. 15 people were injured due to the incident.

298.title: Actor Chiranjeevi seen clicking actor-son Ram Charan's pics with fans; people react
298.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi was seen clicking his actor-son Ram Charan's photos with the latter's fans in a video that is doing rounds on social media. The video of the father-son duo of actors was taken when they were attending a promotional event. Several Twitter users reacted to the video with tweets like, "Proud moment for father," and "It's a lifetime moment."

299.title: Which Indians have taken the most wickets in T20 cricket?
299.article_body: With his three-wicket haul against RCB, RR all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin took his tally of wickets in T20 cricket to 271, becoming the highest wicket-taker among Indians in T20 cricket. He overtook Piyush Chawla, who has taken 270 wickets. Yuzvendra Chahal is the third-highest wicket-taker among Indians with 265 wickets, followed by Amit Mishra (262 wickets).

300.title: Russia quits UN tourism body ahead of vote on its suspension: UNWTO
300.article_body: United Nations' World Tourism Organisation (UNWTO) Secretary-General Zurab Pololikashvili on Wednesday said that Russia is withdrawing from the UN's tourism body. Taking to Twitter, Zurab said, "Today, Russia announced their intention to withdraw from UNWTO." The announcement comes ahead of a vote by UNWTO's executive council to suspend Moscow's membership over its invasion of Ukraine.

301.title: Cong revamps Haryana unit, appoints Udai Bhan as state party chief
301.article_body: Congress on Wednesday revamped its Haryana unit and named four-time legislator Udai Bhan as the new state party chief. Bhan replaced Kumari Selja, who tendered her resignation to Congress' high command recently and described herself as a "true soldier" of the party. Additionally, Congress appointed Shruti Choudhry, Ram Kishan Gujjar, Jitender Kumar Bhardwaj and Suresh Gupta as working presidents.

302.title: Won't happen here: T'gana CM as K'taka minister quits over contractor's death
302.article_body:
A few days after Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa resigned over a contractor's death, Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao said that such an incident would not take place in Telangana. 
"We have seen a minister losing his ministry in Karnataka but that will not happen in Telangana," KCR said. Contractor Santosh Patil was found dead at a hotel in Udupi.

303.title: Fire due to MCD's negligence: Gopal Rai over Bhalswa fire
303.article_body: A day after a massive fire broke out at Bhalswa landfill in Delhi, Environment Minister Gopal Rai accused the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) of negligence. "The people of Delhi are facing landfill fire due to MCD's negligence and 15 years of BJP's corruption," he said. The Delhi Pollution Control Committee has been asked to submit a report, he added.

304.title: UP official asked to serve mid-day meals to students for delaying RTI reply
304.article_body: In a "symbolic punishment", UP State Information Commission has reportedly asked a Public Information Officer to serve mid-day meals to over 200 students of a primary school in Ghazipur. The punishment was announced after Chandrika Prasad, PIO of Noonra village, delayed in replying to an RTI application. Prasad will have to submit a video of the act to the commission.

305.title: BBMP or BESCOM, no one will be spared: K'taka CM Basavaraj Bommai
305.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai assured probe into the case where a 22-year-old man was electrocuted in Bengaluru and said that no one, be it BBMP or BESCOM, will be spared. "I have asked police officers to probe the matter and we will take necessary action," he said. He added that compensation will be given as per the electricity department norms.

306.title: Video shows Putin's hand shaking uncontrollably amid rumours of Parkinson's disease
306.article_body: Rumours of Russian President Vladimir Putin's failing health have emerged after video footage seemed to show him suffering tremors. New footage of a meeting between him and his Belarusian ally Aleksandr Lukashenko shows Putin hold his arm to his chest in an apparent effort to stop his hand from shaking violently. Rumours have suggested he may have Parkinson's disease.

307.title: Hyd Customs seize gold worth ₹86 lakh concealed in undergarments
307.article_body: Hyderabad Customs officials detected and seized 1614 grams of gold valued at ₹86.42 lakh from a female passenger, who had arrived from Dubai. The officials found gold in paste form concealed in her undergarments. In another incident, customs officials on April 6 had seized gold worth ₹24.820 lakh concealed in a man's trousers and undergarments.

308.title: Tragedy beyond words: President Kovind on electrocution deaths in TN
308.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Wednesday condoled the loss of lives because of electrocution in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur, saying it is a tragedy beyond words. Eleven people, including children, were electrocuted during a temple chariot procession when it came in contact with a high tension transmission line. "I pray for the speedy recovery of the injured," President Kovind tweeted.

309.title: Uniform Civil Code should be implemented, RPI (A) backs it: Athawale
309.article_body: Union Minister and Republican Party of India (A) supremo Ramdas Athawale said on Wednesday that party backs Uniform Civil Code (UCC) and will support it when it's tabled in parliament. "I think...there should be a common law for all," he added. Athawale's remarks come amid the proposed implementation of the UCC by some BJP-ruled states, including Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh.

310.title: Is it proper to use 'jumla' for PM: Delhi HC on Khalid's bail plea
310.article_body: While hearing the bail application of student activist Umar Khalid, the Delhi High Court on Wednesday asked whether it was proper to use the term 'jumla' regarding the PM of India. The court said that a "lakshman rekha" has to be there for criticising the government. "Criticism of the government cannot become a crime," said senior advocate Trideep Pais.

311.title: Actor Kenneth Tsang found dead in Hong Kong's COVID-19 quarantine hotel
311.article_body: Kenneth Tsang, the 86-year-old veteran Hong Kong actor who was also a familiar face on Singapore television, was found dead on Wednesday at a hotel in Hong Kong. He was undergoing the city's mandatory travel quarantine for COVID-19 at the hotel after returning from Singapore on Monday, reports said. He had tested negative for COVID-19 on Tuesday, the reports added.

312.title: Australian inflation hits 20-yr high, petrol prices rise 35%
312.article_body: Australia's annual inflation rate hit 5.1% in Q1 2022, from 3.5% the previous quarter and the highest rate since 2001. While petrol prices gained 35%, cost of new dwellings climbed a record 13.7% and food prices also picked up. This could make the Reserve Bank of Australia raise interest rates from record lows ahead of the federal election, Reuters reported.

313.title: Indian photographer's pic of Srinagar kebab seller wins int'l food photo contest
313.article_body: Indian photographer Debdatta Chakraborty has been named the overall winner of Pink Lady Food Photographer of the Year 2022. Titled 'Kebabiyana', the photograph taken in Srinagar showed a kebab seller on a busy street at night. "This image, gentle but powerful, nourishes our soul," Caroline Kenyon, the founder of the award, said.

314.title: 2016 EgyptAir flight crash that killed 66 caused by pilot's lit cigarette, probe finds
314.article_body: The 2016 EgyptAir flight crash that killed 66 was caused by a pilot smoking a cigarette, an investigation found. The Airbus A320 plane was travelling from France to Egypt in May 2016 when it crashed into the sea south of Crete. The cigarette inadvertently ignited oxygen leaking from an emergency gas mask leading to the fire and crash, probe found.

315.title: 3 students critical as lift collapses at IMS college in Ghaziabad
315.article_body: At least eight students were injured after the lift they were in collapsed at an engineering college in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. Three students are said to be critical. "Eight students reported injuries after a lift fell in the IMS college in Dasna, Ghaziabad," a senior police official said. He added that all students were admitted to a nearby hospital.

316.title: ED attaches ₹6.17 cr of fintech firms linked to Chinese nationals
316.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has provisionally attached ₹6.17 crore lying in bank and payment gateway accounts linked to fintech firms and individuals, including Chinese nationals, accused of lending money at usurious rates during the pandemic. According to ED, the accused issued loans and raised investments through mobile apps. The firms were registered on Chinese nationals' instructions.

317.title: PM quoting only Opposition-ruled states to reduce VAT on fuel: DMK
317.article_body: DMK's TKS Elangovan accused PM Narendra Modi of quoting only opposition-ruled states to reduce taxes on fuel. "[PM Modi] won't say that Gujarat or Karnataka should reduce taxes," Elangovan said. This comes after PM Modi urged governments of Maharashtra, West Bengal, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Jharkhand and Tamil Nadu to reduce VAT on fuel during his meeting with the CMs.

318.title: It's any actress' dream: Urvashi Rautela on sharing screen with SRK
318.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela was recently spotted at Baba Siddique's Iftar party, which was also attended by celebrities including Shah Rukh Khan. When asked if she'd like to work with actor Shah Rukh Khan, Urvashi said, "I would really wish and wait for the opportunity to share screen opposite Shahrukh Khan. It's any actress' dream. Hope that happens soon."

319.title: Shweta responds to trolls in new post, asks 'Tere baap ka kya jaata hai'
319.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari has responded to trolls who question her for laughing too much in pictures with a new post on Instagram. The actress shared pictures of herself laughing and captioned it, "They (trolls): 'Itna kya hans rahi hai! (Why are you laughing so much) Us: 'tere Baap ka kya jaata hai (what has your father got to lose)'."

320.title: Russia-backed Moldovan breakaway region says shots fired from Ukraine
320.article_body: Moldova's pro-Russian breakaway region of Transdniestria claimed on Wednesday that shots from Ukraine were fired towards its village Cobasna, which houses an ammunition depot. Transdniestria further claimed that several Ukrainian drones had been detected flying over Cobasna. This comes days after Moldova accused Russia of seeking to recruit its citizens from the region to fight in Ukraine war.

321.title: Don't oppose every step just to appear on TV: Mann to Opposition
321.article_body: Reacting to Opposition's criticism on Knowledge Sharing Agreement signed between Delhi-Punjab government, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said, "Opposition parties should not oppose every step being taken just to appear on TV." "Opposition parties should give us time," he added. "Navjot Singh Sidhu is questioning us on Power Purchase Agreements. When he was made Power Minister, he ran away," Mann said.

322.title: Malaysia to lift COVID-19 curbs including outdoor mask rule from May
322.article_body: Malaysia's Health Minister Khairy Jamaluddin on Wednesday said that the country will ease more COVID-19 restrictions, including scrapping the need to wear masks outdoors from the start of May. He, however, said that masks will remain mandatory for indoor activities and on public transport. People will now be able to enter public premises regardless of their vaccination status, Jamaluddin added.

323.title: Ram Charan visits Vijayawada's Kanakadurgamma Temple ahead of Acharya's release
323.article_body: Ram Charan and director Koratala Siva visited the Kanakadurgamma Temple in Vijayawada to offer prayers before Acharya's release on April 29. While the 'RRR' actor wore an all-black kurta pyjama look yet again, Siva was clicked in a semi-formal look with a shirt and denim. Yesterday, actors Chiranjeevi and Ram Charan were spotted in Hyderabad to promote 'Acharya'.

324.title: There's no action hero of my age in H'wood, want to try my luck there: Tiger
324.article_body: Tiger Shroff said there's a void in terms of a young action hero in Hollywood, adding "[There are] Tom Cruise and Jackie Chan, but there isn't any action hero...of my age group." "It's been a while since [I've] seen somebody with that skill set...portraying action or the kind of action I do...But that's my goal...to...try my luck in...Hollywood," he said.

325.title: Greece to help neighbour Bulgaria after Russia cuts gas supply
325.article_body: Greece will help Bulgaria deal with the new situation caused by the Russian decision to halt gas supplies to the country, Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis told his Bulgarian counterpart Kiril Petkov during a phone call. Petkov said that Mitsotakis has assured him that a long-delayed gas link between the two neighbours, the Interconnector Greece-Bulgaria (IGB), will be ready by June.

326.title: Give Karim Benzema the Ballon d'Or: Ex-Real Madrid player Mesut Özil
326.article_body: Reacting to Real Madrid forward Karim Benzema's brace in the first leg of Real Madrid's Champions League semi-final against Manchester City, ex-Real Madrid player Mesut Özil tweeted, "Give...Benzema the Ballon d'Or." Manchester City defeated Real Madrid 4-3 in the first leg with Kevin De Bruyne, Gabriel Jesus, Phil Foden and Bernardo Silva scoring for City.

327.title: BJP never promotes riots but stops them: Madhya Pradesh Minister
327.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Cabinet Minister and BJP leader Vishvas Kailash Sarang has said that "BJP never promotes riots but stops them". This comes after Congress' Digvijaya Singh alleged that BJP is paying poor Muslim youth to pelt stones, adding, "These aren't facts...I'm not accusing anyone." Reacting to Singh's statement, Sarang asked, "How could you level such charges when you...don't have proof."

328.title: I'm bravest actor, what have I left that someone else could do: Ayushmann
328.article_body: When asked about who he thinks is the bravest actor, Ayushmann Khurrana named himself and said he thinks he's the bravest of all. "Whom should I name who can be called braver than me...what have I left that...someone else could have done or thought of doing? But I envy certain characters like Ranbir Kapoor in Rockstar and Barfi," he added.

329.title: Focus should be on stopping fighting: Jaishankar on Ukraine war
329.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the best way to deal with the Ukraine conflict would be to focus on "stopping the fighting and getting the talking" to move forward. He added that India's position on the crisis is best placed to advance such an approach. India has not yet publicly condemned Russia's invasion and has called for dialogue-based resolution.

330.title: I always say that: Salah on whether he is the world's best player
330.article_body: Talking about whether he believes he is the best player in the world, Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah said, "In my mind, yes, I am always saying that...I don't choose anyone other than me." Salah is currently the highest goal-scorer in the ongoing 2021/22 season of the Premier League, having scored 22 goals so far. He has recorded 13 assists.

331.title: BJP targeting the NCP, misusing ED and CBI: Supriya Sule
331.article_body: NCP MP Supriya Sule accused the BJP of targeting the NCP and misusing Central agencies such as ED and CBI against its political opponents. "How is raking up issues like loudspeakers at places of worship going to benefit Maharashtra?" she questioned the BJP. Polarisation through communal unrest would only impact the country's economic growth and development, she added.

332.title: Political asylum only for homeless, I have home in Cong: KV Thomas
332.article_body: Congress leader KV Thomas on Wednesday rejected CPI(M) Kerala secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan's invitation to join the party, stating that he has a home in Congress, adding that political asylum is for the homeless. "Party positions are like tables and chairs. If that is taken away and I am given a stool, I have no problem with that," he said.

333.title: Man tries to sacrifice daughter for treasure in Maha; 9 arrested
333.article_body: Police have arrested nine persons for allegedly trying to sacrifice an 18-year-old in order to find hidden treasure in Maharashtra's Yavatmal. The victim's father had started performing tantrik rituals over the last few days and had dug a pit to bury his daughter, an official said. The victim somehow managed to inform her friend who subsequently informed the police.

334.title: K'taka Home Minister protecting PSI scam accused: DK Shivakumar
334.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Wednesday alleged that state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra is protecting the main accused in the Police Sub-Inspector (PSI) recruitment scam. "Government should give a notice to Jnanendra...for providing protection to Divya Hagaragi (prime accused)," he said. CM Basavaraj Bommai had earlier said that everything related to the PSI scam would be probed.

335.title: 'Mohammadpur is Madhavpuram now': Delhi BJP chief puts up board
335.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Wednesday said that the name of south Delhi's Mohammadpur village has been changed to Madhavpuram. He said that since the Aam Aadmi Party-led government did not act on the proposal submitted by the South Delhi Municipal Corporation in December, the party members have renamed the place on their own.

336.title: China opposes US warship’s passage through Taiwan Strait
336.article_body: The People's Liberation Army (PLA) of China on Wednesday released a statement opposing the passage of a US warship - USS Sampson guided-missile destroyer - through the Taiwan Strait. "The US has been frequently carrying out provocative acts to send wrong signals to 'Taiwan Independence' forces, deliberately undermining peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait," said the statement.

337.title: Sadhguru is on global tour, he didn't meet Will Smith: Sadhguru's team
337.article_body: After several reports claimed that Hollywood star Will Smith was recently in India to meet Sadhguru after the Chris Rock slap controversy, Sadhguru's media relations team confirmed that the news isn't true. They said, "Sadhguru is on a global tour to promote Save Soil Movement. Sadhguru has not met Will Smith recently."

338.title: There’s probably a lot of people praying for my downfall: Naomi Osaka
338.article_body: Ex-world number one Naomi Osaka tweeted that probably there are a lot of people "praying [for her] downfall", but she doesn't feel it as the love overpowers everything. Osaka is a four-time Grand Slam champion. She is the first Japanese tennis player to win Australian Open having won the tournament in 2019. Osaka has played in four tournaments in 2022.

339.title: Instagram tests feature to let users pin posts to their profile
339.article_body: Instagram is testing a new feature to let users pin specific posts to their profile above their photo grid. Users who have access to the feature in the test phase are seeing a 'Pin to your profile' option that can be selected from the three-dot menu next to posts. Currently, users have the option to pin Stories to their profiles.

340.title: Chandigarh to seek French experts' help to protect 12,000 heritage items
340.article_body: The Chandigarh Administration has decided to ask for help from French experts in preserving and protecting its 12,000 heritage items. Reports said that the heritage items may be sold abroad for lakhs. "We will seek their help and have detailed discussion on the issue...we will ask them to help us technologically to protect the items," UT Adviser Dharam Pal said.

341.title: Power company engineer held for taking bribe in Madhya Pradesh
341.article_body: A junior engineer of a government-owned power company was caught red-handed while taking bribe to settle an electricity-related case in Madhya Pradesh on Wednesday. The accused, identified as Virendra Singh Chouhan, was posted in Narsinghpur. According to an EOW official, Chouhan had allegedly demanded ₹15,000 to settle a case related to seizure of electric wires from the complainant's farm.

342.title: Syria's humanitarian situation remains dire amid economic crisis: UN
342.article_body: The UN deputy emergency relief coordinator, Joyce Msuya, on Tuesday said humanitarian situation in Syria remains dire amid a worsening economic crisis in the country. Msuya said, "As the eyes of the world turn to other conflicts, Syria is on the verge of becoming yet another forgotten crisis despite millions of Syrians struggling each month to survive."

343.title: Denmark arrests man for promoting Islamic State on social media
343.article_body:
A man was arrested on Wednesday in Denmark on suspicion of violating the country's anti-terrorism laws by allegedly promoting the Islamic State group on social media. Police gave no other details except 
that the domestic security agency PET was involved in the operation. Last month, PET had said that Denmark's "biggest terrorist threat" remains people who sympathise with Islamic militants.

344.title: Man rapes cow in UP, arrested after neighbour finds CCTV footage
344.article_body: A man in Lucknow has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a cow. The complainant alleged that the man was seen having sex with the cow on Saturday in CCTV footage. The neighbour then informed the owner of the cow after which a search party was formed by the locals to apprehend the accused.

345.title: 17-year-old Pune girl found 3-month pregnant, rape case filed against husband, father
345.article_body: Pune Police filed a case of rape and invoked anti-child marriage legislation after receiving report from a government hospital of a 17-year-old girl being three months pregnant. Police have booked the girl's 19-year-old husband and father. Police said that they have provided counsellor support to the girl and were in contact with both families to sensitively deal with the situation.

346.title: Only mom & I live in my mansion, I wander in the house at night: Nawazuddin
346.article_body: In a new video posted by RJ Siddharth Kannan, he gave a quick tour of Nawazuddin Siddiqui's Mumbai mansion. The video also included audio clips of their conversation about the actor's home. In the clip, Nawazuddin is heard saying, "Only my mother and I live in this house. At night, when I'm unable to sleep...I wander around like a ghost."

347.title: I will choose Cristiano Ronaldo over Lionel Messi in my team: Kaka
