347.article_body: Ex-Real Madrid footballer Kaka said he will choose Cristiano Ronaldo over Lionel Messi in his team, adding that the chances of Ronaldo's failure are very less as he is very determined and focused. "Messi is a genius and Ronaldo has a very strong mentality," stated Kaka. Ronaldo currently represents Manchester United having earlier played for Real Madrid and Juventus.

348.title: Stopped from thrashing wife, UP man sets mom ablaze; consumes poison
348.article_body: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi allegedly set his 60-year-old mother on fire after she stopped him from thrashing his wife. The accused, Mahajan, later consumed poison himself. While his mother died, Mahajan is struggling for life. Reports said Mahajan used to pressure his mother to empty her room as he wanted to stay there with his wife and children.

349.title: Why do you dub your movies in Hindi if it's not our national language: Ajay to Sudeep
349.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn has reacted to Kannada actor Kiccha Sudeep's remark that Hindi is "no more" a national language. Ajay tweeted, "According to you, if Hindi is not our national language then why do you release your mother tongue movies by dubbing them in Hindi?" Ajay added, "Hindi was, is and always will be our mother tongue and national language."

350.title: 'Hobbit' human ancestors may be hiding on Indonesian island: Anthropologist
350.article_body: An anthropologist retired from the University of Alberta has claimed that "Hobbit" human ancestors or Homo floresiensis may still be hiding on an Indonesian island. Studies over the years concluded that they went extinct some 12,000 years ago. Gregory Forth's book includes sighting reports from over 30 eyewitnesses, with whom he spoke directly.

351.title: ‘Heropanti 2’ is not muddy and dirty, every frame is slick: Tiger Shroff
351.article_body: Talking about his upcoming film ‘Heropanti 2’, actor Tiger Shroff said, “‘Heropanti 2’ is not muddy and dirty, every frame is slick.” “It has the vibe of say ‘Mission Impossible’ meets ‘James Bond’ meets ‘War’,” added Tiger. Discussing movies from the ‘Baaghi’ franchise in which he stars as well, Tiger stated that ‘Baaghi’ was raw and rustic.

352.title: India's alternative fuels sector to create 50-60 lakh jobs: Gadkari
352.article_body: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said the alternative fuels sector will create 50-60 lakh jobs in India. He added that green hydrogen is the way forward and in the future, India will lead the world in this space. "My request to all manufacturers is that we need green hydrogen, because the government has a commitment for the environment," he stated.

353.title: Pak PM’s pre-arrest bail extended in money laundering case
353.article_body: A Pakistani court on Wednesday extended the pre-arrest bail granted to PM Shehbaz Sharif and his son Hamza Shehbaz, who is Punjab CM-elect, in a PKR 14 billion (₹574 crore) money laundering case. The PM was also granted exemption from appearing in person before the court. Sharif and his two sons were booked by Pakistan's Federal Investigation Agency in 2020.

354.title: UN chief Antonio Guterres condemns Karachi blast that killed 4
354.article_body: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Tuesday condemned the attack that occurred inside the premises of the University of Karachi in Pakistan and expressed his condolences, said his Deputy spokesman, Farhan Haq. Three Chinese nationals were among the four persons who were killed in the blast. The blast reportedly occurred in a van near the gate of the Confucius Institute.

355.title: Nepal bans import of 10 items, including cars, amid forex crisis
355.article_body: Nepal has banned import of 10 luxurious items, including cars and diamonds, amid its depleting foreign exchange reserves. The ban, which will be in place until end of this fiscal year in mid-July, will include other items such as liquor, cigarette and tobacco products and motorcycles. Earlier this month, Nepal urged citizens living abroad to deposit funds in domestic banks.

356.title: Climate change risking 10-18% of South Asia's GDP: Study
356.article_body: Climate change could see 10-18% of GDP of South Asian countries like India, Bangladesh and Pakistan lost by 2050, a study by ratings firm S&P Global revealed. This is 10 times the risk to Europe and three times the risk to North America. Overall, climate change could put 4% of global GDP at risk by 2050, the report stated.

357.title: Would've liked Will Smith but not now: Henry on which actor should play him
357.article_body: Ex-Arsenal forward Thierry Henry said he would have earlier liked to name Will Smith as the actor who should portray him in a film, but will not do so now. "I would go [with] Chris Tucker," added Henry. Smith recently resigned from the Oscars Academy after slapping Chris Rock at Oscars, for making a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett.

358.title: I'm part of Salman Khan's 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali': Aayush Sharma
358.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma has confirmed that he will be joining Salman Khan in the film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', which will be directed by Farhad Samji. "Yes, I am a part of the film and I'm looking forward to experimenting with my cinematic aptitude with this project," Aayush stated. The duo previously shared screen space in 'Antim: The Final Truth'.

359.title: 3 men, including boyfriend, rape minor girl in Nagpur; arrested
359.article_body: A minor girl was allegedly gang-raped by her boyfriend and two of his friends in Nagpur, following which the three were arrested. On April 17, the accused shared intimate videos he had recorded without the girl's permission with his friends and used them to ask for sexual favours for the two. The group then allegedly gang-raped the minor, reports said.

360.title: Justin Lin steps down as 'Fast X' director after 10 yrs with franchise
360.article_body: Justin Lin has stepped down as the director of 'Fast X' after being associated with the franchise for 10 years. In a statement released by the franchise's official Twitter handle, Justin said, "I've made the difficult decision to step back as director of 'Fast X'." "Over 10 years...five films, we've been able to shoot the best actors...stunts...car chases," he added.

361.title: Reduce central excise first: Cong on PM's appeal to states to reduce VAT on fuel
361.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to CMs of Maharashtra, West Bengal, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Jharkhand and Tamil Nadu to reduce VAT on petrol and diesel, Congress said that he should first reduce central excise. "(Centre) earned ₹26 lakh crore out of central excise...(and) didn't give the GST share to the states on time," Congress' Pawan Khera said.

362.title: Man, wife stabbed to death in UP's Muzaffarnagar over old rivalry
362.article_body: A 50-year-old man and his 48-year-old wife were allegedly stabbed to death by three people in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar over an old rivalry, police said on Wednesday. The accused pulled the victims out of an e-rickshaw and killed them, police added. The husband and his two sons were arrested in a murder case in June 2021, police stated.

363.title: EU accuses Russia of blackmail as it cuts gas to Poland & Bulgaria
363.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said that Russia's decision to stop delivering gas to Bulgaria and Poland is "an instrument of blackmail". The move is "unjustified and unacceptable" and shows the unreliability of Russia as a gas supplier, she added. The EU is working on a coordinated response to the escalation by Moscow, she further said.

364.title: 5 killed, 1 injured as SUV falls into canal in Punjab's Ludhiana
364.article_body: As many as five persons were killed and one was injured as the SUV they were travelling in fell into the Sidhwan canal in Punjab's Ludhiana, police said. The SUV's doors got locked inside the water and by the time the victims were taken out from the canal, they were all dead, except one, police added.

365.title: Warner Bros officially announces 'The Batman 2' at the CinemaCon 2022
365.article_body: Hollywood studio Warner Bros has officially announced a sequel to Robert Pattinson-starrer 'The Batman' during a presentation at the CinemaCon 2022 on Tuesday. "Matt Reeves (director), Robert and the entire team will be taking audiences back to Gotham with 'The Batman 2'," Warner Bros Pictures Group chief Toby Emmerich said. The 2022 film also featured Zoe Kravitz and Colin Farrell.

366.title: Musk's ideas would be great for Twitter: Largest ad group WPP CEO
366.article_body: World's largest advertising group WPP CEO Mark Read in an interview with Bloomberg Television discussed Elon Musk's Twitter deal, saying, "Many of his ideas around fake bots, and improving the algorithms...would be great for the platform, great for users and great for our clients," Read said. He added he doesn't expect any potential crackdown on advertising on Twitter in future.

367.title: Copied some moves from Abhishek's dancing as a kid: Big B on 'Khaike Paan...'
367.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said on Instagram that some of his dance steps in the song 'Khaike Paan Banaraswala' from his film 'Don', were "copied" from son Abhishek Bachchan's sideways movement as a kid. "Haha, still moving sideways," read the reaction from Abhishek to the post shared by Amitabh, which featured a clip of him dancing to the song.

368.title: LIC to reserve 10% of IPO size for policyholders
368.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) on Wednesday announced that it will be reserving 10% of its IPO size, or 2.21 crore shares, for policyholders. Additionally, policyholders will be offered a discount of ₹60/share while employees and retail investors will be offered a discount of ₹45/share. The maximum bid amount under the Policyholder Reservation Portion must not exceed ₹2 lakh.

369.title: Kerala University distributes answer key instead of paper, Guv seeks report
369.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan has sought a report after the answer key was distributed instead of question paper to students in an exam at Kerala University. The Governor has also sought a report after exams were postponed at Kannur University when it was found that the previous year's question papers have been repeated once again this year.

370.title: BJP, VHP hold protest march in Raj against Alwar temple demolition
370.article_body: BJP, VHP and other Hindu organisations on Wednesday held a protest march in Rajasthan against the demolition of a 300-year-old Shiva temple in Alwar. BJP MP Balaknath said, "We've demanded...action against involved officers, construction of the demolished temple and resignation of Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot." Notably, the state government has suspended three officials over the temple's demolition.

371.title: 500+ left homeless as fire at Manesar scrapyard destroys 100+ shanties
371.article_body: After a massive fire broke out in a scrapyard in sector 6 of IMT Manesar on Monday night, over 100 hutments were destroyed, leaving over 500 people homeless. A 48-year-old woman was also killed in the incident. A resident of the area said that she and her family had to leave everything, including ₹1.5 lakh case they had saved, behind.

372.title: Masks made mandatory in Kerala amid COVID surge, violation punishable
372.article_body: Amid rise in COVID-19 cases, the Kerala government on Wednesday made wearing of masks mandatory. In its latest order, the government has said that any violation to the rule will be punishable. State Health Minister Veena George had earlier said that the government would  "continue to remain vigilant since other states are reporting an increase in the number of cases".

373.title: Deepika Padukone to be part of Cannes Film Festival 2022 jury
373.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone will be a part of the main jury at the Cannes Film Festival this year. The jury for the festival's 75th edition will be presided over by French actor Vincent Lindon. Lindon, along with the jury members, will reward one of the 21 films in competition with the Palme d'or, on May 28, during the closing ceremony.

374.title: Which overseas players have recorded most ducks in IPL?
374.article_body: With his golden duck against RR, Glenn Maxwell recorded his 12th duck in the history of IPL. It is the most number of ducks by an overseas cricketer. He overtook Rashid Khan, who has 11 IPL ducks to his name. Sunil Narine and AB de Villiers have been dismissed on a duck 10 times each.

375.title: Michael Slater avoids jail in domestic violence case, sent to mental health hospital
375.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Michael Slater avoided jail on Wednesday after a court in Sydney dismissed domestic violence charges against him on mental health grounds. The court has ordered Slater to spend three weeks in a mental health hospital. Slater has been arrested multiple times for domestic violence against his ex-girlfriend.

376.title: I think I broke 3-4 remote controls: Ricky Ponting on RR-DC match
376.article_body: Referring to RR-DC match which he missed due to quarantine, DC head coach Ricky Ponting said, "It was frustrating. I think I broke three or four remote controls." He added, "When you're on sidelines...being a coach...and you can't control what's happening out in the middle...that's hard enough...but when you're not actually at ground...it can get a little more frustrating."

377.title: NCPCR seeks report as B'luru school allegedly asks kids to carry Bible
377.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has sought a report from the district administration after a Bengaluru school allegedly asked children to carry Bibles. Right-wing group Hindu Janajagruti Samiti had alleged the school took an undertaking from parents to allow students to carry Bibles. The group's members also met Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh over the matter.

378.title: They will feel 'really hurt': Daniel Vettori on RCB's 29-run loss vs RR
378.article_body: Discussing RCB's defeat by 29 runs against RR having been handed a target of 145, ex-RCB captain Daniel Vettori said the RCB players will feel "really hurt" by the performance of their batters. "RCB's bowling unit...[was] fantastic and disciplined," added Vettori. RCB were bowled out for 115 with captain Faf Du Plessis their highest run-getter, having scored 23 runs.

379.title: Kohli has experienced these highs and lows before too: Bangar
379.article_body: RCB head coach Sanjay Bangar has said Virat Kohli has experienced "highs and lows many times before" and he'll soon emerge from "this run of low scores". Bangar added, "Kohli is so mentally strong, he'll be able to put in better performance [in upcoming games]." Kohli has scored 128 runs in nine games so far this season.

380.title: I'll go if I lose majority in Parliament: SL PM amid resignation calls
380.article_body: Sri Lanka PM Mahinda Rajapaksa has said that he will only step down if he loses the majority in the Parliament. Anti-government protesters in Sri Lanka are demanding the PM and his younger brother President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's resignation over the island nation's worsening economic crisis. The crisis has led to a shortage of essential items in the country.

381.title: PM Narendra Modi inaugurates children's heart hospital in Fiji
381.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated the Sri Sathya Sai Sanjeevani Children's Heart Hospital in Fiji via video conferencing. "I express my gratitude to the Prime Minister of Fiji and the people of Fiji for this," he added. "This is a symbol of our traditional relationship and another chapter in the shared journey of India-Fiji," PM Modi further said.

382.title: Thieves in business attire fly from Delhi to Kochi to rob big houses; arrested
382.article_body: The police have arrested a trio of thieves who landed in Kerala's Kochi from Delhi in business attire to rob big houses. They allegedly carried out thefts in four houses on consecutive days from April 21, reports say. Approximately 160 gm of gold ornaments amounting to ₹8 lakh, ₹70,000 cash, $411 and wristwatches including a Rolex were recovered from them.

383.title: It worries me a lot more than the 68 all out: Bishop on RCB's loss vs RR
383.article_body: Reacting to RCB's loss by 29 runs against RR, ex-West Indies pacer Ian Bishop said the defeat worries him a "lot more" than the team being bowled out for 68 runs, in their previous match against SRH. "I am still not seeing Virat Kohli getting the runs that he needs to get for this team to prosper," added Bishop.

384.title: Delhi school near Bhalswa landfill shut due to toxic smoke after fire
384.article_body: Delhi's Gyan Sarovar School has been temporarily closed after a massive fire broke out at Bhalswa landfill site on Tuesday. "It's not safe to keep children here because of the smoke...We've decided to keep the school closed for a week," a community organiser said. Locals living near the area complained of breathing and visibility issues, as per ANI report.

385.title: PM Modi asks states to audit hospitals to prevent fire incidents
385.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday asked all states to ensure safety audits of hospitals on a priority basis. "I urge all states to get safety audits of all hospitals done on a priority basis to prevent fire incidents which have been increasing amid heatwave. Our response time should also be minimal," he said during a COVID-19 review meeting with CMs.

386.title: When rules-based order was challenged in Asia, Europe advised us to do more trade: EAM
386.article_body: Defending India's stand on Russia-Ukraine conflict, EAM S Jaishankar told European leaders, "When the rules-based order was under challenge in Asia, the advice we got from Europe was do more trade. At least we're not giving you that advice." He added, "In terms of Afghanistan, please show me which part of the rules-based order justified what the world did there."

387.title: We shot at a place where shooting was termed impossible: 'Thar' director Raj
387.article_body: Sharing his experience while shooting his film 'Thar', director Raj Singh Chaudhary said, "It was a tough shoot in terms of terrain...One such location was...an 800-year-old structure." "The production [team] told me...it was impossible to shoot there [as it's in the middle of nowhere on top of the mountain]. I convinced them and the production [team]...created a road," added Raj.

388.title: Do well: Sushmita to fan who stalks her profile for motivation amid exam stress
388.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen replied to a fan who stalked her on Instagram to get motivation amid exam stress. The user commented on her post stating, "My ICSE exams have started and I'm feeling...tensed right now. I'm...stalking your profile and reading the captions for some motivation." To which, Sushmita replied, "All the best jaan meri...study and do your best! You'll do...well."

389.title: 5 Pune mosques say no to DJ music during Eid amid loudspeaker row
389.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy over usage of loudspeakers at religious places, authorities of five mosques in Pune have decided to shun DJ music during Eid al-Fitr celebration on May 2. The authorities also appealed to the community to avoid playing loud music during festival, adding that funds collected to procure the DJ systems should be used to aid needy people.

390.title: Delhi temperature likely to cross 44°C tomorrow, yellow alert issued
390.article_body: The temperature in Delhi is expected to cross the 42-degree mark today and 44-degree mark on Thursday. The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert warning of a heatwave spell in the national capital, starting April 28. PTI also quoted an official as saying that the maximum temperature may leap to 46 degree Celsius in parts of Delhi.

391.title: I became over-sensitive: Eijaz Khan on challenges faced while growing up
391.article_body: Discussing the impact of challenges faced while growing up, actor Eijaz Khan said, "I became over-sensitive and...started working from a space of a victim." "I try to see that my childhood trauma or whatever traumas we face in our formative years, if it has put speed breakers...in my growth and relationships now, then I go for therapy," added Eijaz.

392.title: Delhi govt to develop over 2000 classrooms as 'hi-tech digital'
392.article_body: The Delhi government has announced its plan to develop over 2000 classrooms as 'hi-tech digital' facilities for students of classes 6 to 12 of government schools. About 2,211 classrooms will be developed as digital classrooms, with 75 inches or bigger interactive flat display panels, UHD resolution and touch screen. The estimated cost of the project is ₹65.43 crore, reports said.

393.title: New Delhi Railway Station's revamp to decongest CP: RLDA VC
393.article_body: New Delhi Railway Station's redevelopment will help in decongesting Connaught Place and is expected to generate revenue of ₹10,000-12,000 crore, Rail Land Development Authority (RLDA) VC VP Dudeja said. Under the project, a 40-storey commercial twin-tower will be built. Two multi-modal transport hubs, one on Ajmeri Gate side and another on Paharganj side, will also be developed, Dudeja added.

394.title: We cannot please other nations by being 'pale imitation' of what they are: India
394.article_body: Amid pressure from the West to take a strong stand on Russia's Ukraine invasion, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said, "I think it's better to engage with the world on the basis of who we are." He further said that India cannot please other nations by "being a pale imitation of what they are".

395.title: Country needs alternative agenda, not political regrouping: T'gana CM
395.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday said the country needs alternative agenda and not political fronts or political realignment. While addressing members on 21st foundation day of Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS), Rao said that he had turned down the idea of communist leaders to 'dislodge' the BJP, adding, the focus should not be on bringing down any party.

396.title: Mira Kapoor invests in organic grocery startup ﻿Zama Organics
396.article_body: Mira Kapoor has invested an undisclosed amount in organic and healthy grocery startup Zama Organics. Founded by Shriya Naheta Wadhwa, Zama Organics focuses on building a farm-to-table supply chain for organic and natural vegetables, fruits and groceries. It is backed by angel investors like BillDesk Director and Co-Founder Ajay Kaushal and Guardian Advisors Director Arjun Lamba, among others.

397.title: Something bad happens in Bollywood, then entire industry is b**ch: Ajay Devgn
397.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said that the entire industry is called b**ch if something bad happens [in Bollywood] like if "X person says something". "And maybe that person is not part of industry, he may be a so-called actor or struggler but the HL says Actor XYZ did," he said, adding, "People are like...why are...celebs quiet...because there is reaction to everything."

398.title: Speeding garbage truck hits bike in Mumbai, 16-year-old killed
398.article_body: A 16-year-old girl who was riding pillion on a bike with her 23-year-old friend died after a speeding garbage truck hit their two-wheeler on Mumbai's Western Express highway in Malad (East). The duo were on their way home when the truck hit them and the girl went under the wheels of the heavy vehicle, the police said.

399.title: Pune farmer hires helicopter to bring home newborn granddaughter
399.article_body: A farmer from Pune's Balewadi hired a helicopter to bring his newborn granddaughter and daughter-in-law home on Tuesday. The man, Ajit Pandurang Balwadkar, told reporters that he wanted to accord a special welcome to his granddaughter Krushika, who was residing at her maternal grandparents' house in Shewal Wadi. Balwadkar then sent a helicopter there to pick them up.

400.title: Mumtaz gets discharged from hospital, says 'I'm weak but I have recovered'
400.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz, who was admitted to hospital because of a severe stomach infection, has been discharged now. Speaking about it, Mumtaz said, "It was a very bad infection and I had to be hospitalised. I was there for a...week and now I'm back home, weak but fully recovered." "We need much better healthcare for the underprivileged," she added.

401.title: SDMC to start anti-encroachment drive in Delhi’s Jaitpur: Mayor
401.article_body: South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) Mayor Mukesh Suryan on Wednesday said that an anti-encroachment drive will soon be conducted in Delhi's Jaitpur. A team of SDMC officials reached the area for inspection before starting the drive. "There have been several complaints of illegal encroachment here…Some of them have been identified," said Suryan.

402.title: Man arrested for stalking PhD scholar on IISc campus in Bengaluru
402.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested at the Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru, for stalking a 27-year-old PhD scholar. According to the woman, the man was her former university mate and was deliberate to have a relationship with her, which she rejected. The man also allegedly posted the woman's pictures on his Facebook account, stating that she was his wife.
